examine: This faceted round jewel is yellow, yet it features with many small colour variations depending on the angle of light that hits it, or lack thereof.
name: a citrine

special_abilities: When embedded, it greatly reduces the mana cost of locate spells.

examine: This heavy, thick metal breastplate was obviously crafted by a master armourer. It will protect its owner from all but the mightiest blows.
name: a white metal breastplate

examine: This piece of fat-marbled, raw meat is dark-red in colour. One of the edges is covered with a strip of bright, clean white fat. Dark blood seeps through the tissue, indicating that the animal was recently butchered.
name: a piece of raw bear meat

examine: There is no writing on the note.
name: a piece of paper

examine: Leonard's notes on getting through a scrap 1. I have to change my mood to fit the fight. Aggressive to finish the fight quickly, wimpy to protect myself, the old warrior said. 2. If I get hurt, there is no shame in fleeing. Set a wimpy, the old warrior said - is that a state of being I wonder? Whatever he meant, it sounded important. 3. A dented blade deals little damage. I'll have to find myself a whetstone to whet my blades and keep a keen edge on them. 4. My armour, though, I can't mend that myself! I'll have to drop by a smith to help me mend those. 5. Best learn how to tend to a wound, the ranger said. Practice bandaging with me was his advice. Even though I have no desire to become a doctor, I guess being able to at least stop the bleeding is wise.
name: Leonard's notes on getting through a scrap

examine: This is one of the crystal lamps, made by Noldor in days of past and rarely even seen in Middle-earth. Apart from their creators, only Aule is said to know their secret. This one gleams with a pale, white light and is brighter when the weather is worse.
name: a crystal orb

examine: These sleeves are made of soft leather, which will allow for a basic protection of the arms, as well as protect them partially against forces of nature. A few scratches mar the leather, and the stitching does not look like quality work.
name: a pair of soft leather sleeves

examine: The sleeves are made of small metal rings linked together to form a tight but pretty stiff chainmail. In general, each ring is connected to four others, yet quite some errors in the pattern can be spotted.
name: a pair of chain mail sleeves

examine: These gloves are made of iron rings. Even while smaller rings for the fingers than for the area near the wrists have been used, these gloves are still a bit bulky and handling anything with them seems a bit clumsy.
name: a pair of chain mail gloves

examine: These boots are crafted out of skilfully hardened strips of a dark-coloured leather. Several iron plates are attached to the boots by the aid of steel nails, which leaves the feet protected by durable metal. Long laces are inserted in the upper part of the boots allowing them to be closed around the foot. The toes of the boots have been steel-tipped.
name: a pair of metal boots

examine: Thin thigh and shin guards of hardened leather have been joined together with a set of thick knee guards, to create a pair of trousers-come-greaves that will offer the wearer nice protection, whilst allowing some flexibility.
name: a pair of rigid leather trousers

examine: This cap is moulded from four pieces of dried, hardened leather. The pieces have been stitched tightly together with two further flaps that you can fasten under your chin.
name: a rigid leather helmet

examine: These trousers are designed for durability. They are mostly worn by farmers and their ilk to protect against stains from soil and mud. They are also moderately moisture repellent because of the tight stitching.
name: a pair of blue trousers

examine: These calf-high boots have been fashioned from a thin brown leather, lined with soft fur to add some comfort for the wearer.
name: a pair of soft leather boots

examine: Many rings have been locked into each other to form this armour. This piece of work offers ample protection for the legs, but is only of minor quality.
name: a pair of chain mail leggings

examine: These greaves are forged out of thin, steel plates. They cover the entire leg except for the knees, where small interwoven chains attach to the upper and lower leg parts. Leather laces at the back of the greaves enable them to be adjust to the size of the leg. Some small buckles at the top allow attachment to other pieces of armour.
name: a pair of metal greaves

examine: These are simple robes, made for everyday wear by those who favour this kind of apparel. The fabric of the robes is a rough and lacking in any patterns to distinguish, while the appearance of loose threads and small wear patterns to the cloth suggests that the robe has been washed many a time.
name: a white robe

examine: This dress is stitched from cotton and has been patched with several pieces of linen. It looks like the belongings of a commoner or peasant.
name: a soft blue dress

examine: Made from cast-iron, it is quite obvious this pan will withstand high heat and provide quite a good cooking surface.
name: a pan

examine: This bow is made of flexible wood and a strong tendon has been attached to both ends. The bow roughly measures three feet from one end to the other and is suitable for mobile or small archers.
name: a shortbow

examine: This chain mail hauberk consists of an uncountable amount of iron-rings. Upon closer inspection some half of the rings has a small gap between their begin and end, while the other half is solid; thereby compromising between overall qualtity and time as well as cost to create this armour.
name: a chain mail hauberk

examine: This is a small wooden cart, with four working wheels. From the front hangs a team of carved wooden horses, and from its back a long pole stands up, with a handle on the end.
name: a wooden push-toy

examine: The roughly three feet long shaft of this arrow is quite thin and straight. It is made of pine and has a fletching of grey goose feathers at one end while on the other one a sharp head of metal is attached.
name: an arrow

examine: About six feet long, this staff was crafted from a perfect branch of oak by a master woodworker. Runes are carved on its sides, and its surface is smoothly polished. Truly this is a masterwork of carpentry. Looking closer, you are able to see some more details: namely, a polished white stone has been set in the staff, surrounded by arcane runes, a shining gemstone embedded near its top shimmers with many colours, and a lustrous fire opal has been inlaid in it. Atop the staff, a bronze claw holds a large blue crystal, which glows faintly. You realise that this staff is owned by you.
name: a bejewelled oak staff

special_abilities: It can call a great eagle to carry you long distances.

examine: This patch of short black fur is partially covered with clotted blood. A few marks, left by a sharp tool such as a knife, are visible on the edges.
name: some short, black fur

examine: These white, egg-shaped berries, are about half an inch long, with a smooth and slightly waxy skin. The seeds within are black and shiny, and the berries themselves have a slightly acrid odour.
name: some white, egg-shaped berries

examine: The hide has a dark colour to it, full of scars from old battles of its original owner. Tufts of soot-black hair cover it here and there. It is light in weight and hearty in durability. Whoever or whatever killed the bear to apprehend the fur must have gone a tough round.
name: a soot-black bear hide

examine: The base of this arrow contains feathered fletching. A silvery arrowhead adorns the top of it and assuredly adds to the deadliness if the arrow is used in combat. The shaft feels silk smooth to the hand and seems to be of an incredibly old yet still sturdy wood. This is truly the product of a meticulous and skilled craftsman.
name: a fletched arrow

examine: These gloves have been fashioned from a delicate thin leather. They seem to offer little or no protection, save perhaps from the elements.
name: a pair of soft leather gloves

examine: This snugly fitting jerkin is fashioned from thin pieces of softened leather, carefully stitched together using brown twine. The jerkin is constructed in a manner that allows the wearer flexibility at the cost of protection, save maybe from the elements.
name: a soft leather jerkin

examine: This is an ordinary egg, laid by a hen. It is oval-shaped, with small cracks in the shell.
name: an egg

examine: You see a large pie, filled with a steaming hot mixture of hearty chicken and chestnuts floating in a rich gravy and topped with a golden crust.
name: a chicken and chestnut pie

examine: This expertly crafted helm was forged from a solid piece of metal, curled and hammered and into a formidable design. An ornate nose guard extends from the rim of the helmet. Etched across the entire helm are decorative accents symbolic of Rohan. From atop the helm a mighty silver Rohir steed rises up, as if rearing for battle.
name: a horse-crested helm

examine: Cured and dried so it will not go bad, this meat is tough and unappetizing. It tastes smoky, and is reminiscent of Dwarf.

examine: The fragments of a heavy blade suggest that these are the remains of a large sword. But it is impossible to be sure.
name: some greater parts of a broken weapon

examine: The infusion has a yellow-greenish colour. Fragments of healing herbs float in it. Its smell reminds you of the medicine used by grandma to cure her flu.

special_abilities: It purges all other potion effects and cures flu and amibia.
It increases mana regeneration by six and mana by twelve for one hour.
After that, it increases mana regeneration by three and mana by six for one hour.

examine: This young partridge was wrapped in layers of streaky bacon, then roasted whole. Half of it now takes up much of the space on a large oval plate, the other side of which is filled with two large baked potatoes, served with thick dollops of creamy butter.
name: a plate of roast partridge

examine: This is a quite large helping of pork, thoroughly cooked and lightly seasoned with rosemary. The lean flesh tells you this was no farm-raised pig. No, perhaps only a few hours ago this boar was wandering the landscape, rooting up wild plants and attempting to bash people. Brought down in the hunt, it is a fitting meal for any warrior.
name: some roast pork

examine: It is a rather old-looking three-armed candlestick made from pewter. Its candles are a yellowish white colour.
name: a candlestick

name: a small piece of fish

examine: This piece of fat-marbled, raw meat is dark-red in colour. One of the edges is covered with a strip of bright, clean white fat. Dark blood seeps through the tissue, indicating that the animal was recently butchered.
name: a piece of raw raccoon meat

name: a piece of raw fox meat

examine: It is pure white, and gives off a slight radiance. Delicate silver threads trace out arcane runes, and the lining is embellished with small jewels.
name: a pure white robe

special_abilities: It returns mana after a short period of time when casting certain spells.
This effect does not stack for multiple uses of the same spell, but can be active for several spells at the same time.

name: a small piece of raw ibex meat

name: a piece of raw wolf meat

examine: This piece of fat-marbled, raw meat is dark-red in colour. One of the edges is covered with a strip of bright, clean white fat. Dark blood seeps through the tissue, indicating that the animal was recently butchered.
name: a piece of raw ibex meat

examine: The crust of the loaf is golden-brown and crisp, but the bread itself is white and soft without being too airy and seems as fresh as if it has just been taken out of an oven and cooled. It does not appear to be sweet, but it smells of honey and spices, among which you can recognise cinnamon and cardamom.
name: a loaf of white bread

examine: This is a small, round dumpling. The exterior is a golden-brown crust and it is packed densely with savoury meat and chopped vegetables. Its top outer edges are jagged, having been pinched together to seal in the delicious contents.
name: a savoury baked dumpling

examine: This piece of cheese has been cut from a much larger, round chunk. It has an orange rind and a yellow texture. Small holes can be seen in the sides.
name: a piece of cheese

examine: This bundle of wheat has large, hard grains while the yellow stems are strong and straight.
name: some wheat cereals

examine: A strong, musty odour emanates from this loaf of bread. The crust is covered by white and green mould, which is possibly the source of the scent.
name: a musty loaf of bread

examine: Barliman's special meat pasty is a delicious wonder to behold. It is made from a square of rolled dough, folded over at a corner and filled with meat, potatoes and vegetables. It is quite the pride of the establishment; travellers come from Archet and beyond to partake of the tasty bake.
name: a meat pasty

examine: Thick slices of juicy meat sit amid a pool of dark brown, aromatic gravy. Next to the mutton has been set a heaping pile of roasted potatoes, and the platter is filled out with a generous portion of mixed vegetables.
name: a plate of roast mutton

examine: This hearty stew consists of big chunks of the local game and vegetables, cooked in a brownish gravy and pleasantly spiced. You recognise pork, beef, carrots, turnips, taters, onions, and whatever else is in season.
name: a bowl of stew

examine: This is a bowl of cracked corn, barley, and other local grains, boiled up into a thick porridge. Perhaps not the tastiest of meals but cheap and filling.
name: a bowl of gruel

examine: This medium-sized cod looks almost ready to eat. All you need is the fire to start cooking it over. I'd suggest you start building that fire.
name: a small cod

examine: They are large, ripe and shiny berries, although not very filling unless you ate a huge number of them.
name: some cherries

examine:
CONSIDER:
They are some hollyberries.
They weigh about an ounce.
name: some hollyberries

examine: These brown beans have been removed from their hulls and seem to be ready for cooking. Boiled in a dish aside with some cheese and vegetables they could form a good meal.
name: some beans

examine: A double row of small golden grains runs up and down the tip of each stalk. The barley is ripe and ready for use.
name: some barley

examine: These acorns are the simple fruits from an oak. They are oval shaped and of a light to dark brown colour. They seem edible, yet maybe only squirrels can truly appreciate their flavour.
name: some acorns

examine: It is a large, brown boletus that must weigh nearly five pounds. The top surface is covered in a thin layer of transparent slime that emits a weak, musty smell. Not the most delicious thing you have seen.
name: a toadstool

examine: This certainly does not look appetizing, but it may be edible.
name: a green slime mould

examine: This salmon looks quite tasty. You are very tempted to take this right to the frying pan and start cooking it. It is not particularly large, but it will provide a good solid meal.
name: a nice fresh salmon

examine: The salad bowl has lettuce which is green and crisp, with small, sliced carrots and little tomatoes tossed into the mix to make a nutritious meal.
name: a bowl of salad

examine: These nuts are varying in size, ranging from barely an inch to one and a half. The actual nut is hidden inside a brown, hard shell, serving as protection from anyone who might want to eat it.
name: some pine nuts

examine: A pleasant gamey smell assails your nostrils from this sizeable platter of roasted meat. Thick gravy steams atop and beside the meat, and partially covers a pile of mashed potatoes. A generous helping of redcurrant chutney and a large portion of mixed vegetables fill out the plate.
name: a plate of roast venison

examine: Brownish-purple and round, this tuber still has a thick dusting of dirt. Three stems stick out of the top, purple with vivid, green leaves. If it were washed and roasted, it would probably taste delicious.
name: a beet

examine: The sticky candy is wrapped in a sheet of very thin paper. The brown colour of butterscotch is mixed with lighter bands of yellow from a honey-mixture.
name: a small piece of soft candy

examine: A few squares of dark chocolate are wrapped in a glittering wrapper with bright flowers painted on it.
name: a small piece of chocolate

examine: This nicely shaped round turnip is quite large. While mostly white-skinned, its upper part is of a reddish colour. It appears quite wholesome to eat.
name: a turnip

examine: The leaves of this cabbage have a dark green colour. Some small holes, possibly made by larvae, can be seen on the younger innermost leaves. Near the root of the plant the outer leaves smell rotten.
name: a cabbage

examine: It is about the length of a man and a handspan across. You can see no blemish or crack on its surface. In your hands, it is almost warm, almost living.
name: a perfect oak branch

examine: This pie has a light and flaky crust. The meat of the pie smells well seasoned with a nutty flavour.
name: a mince-pie

examine: Leonard's notes on staying well fed 1. There's no point staying hungry or thirsty out there. Tired legs won't get any fresher on an empty stomach or dry throat! 2. I must remember to pour water into my water skins whenever I come across a spring or stream of fresh water in the wild. 3. Hunting deer or even something smaller like a rabbit is a great way to renew my food supply. Just as long as I keep a knife handy for the butchering. 4. If I remember to bring a pan I can cook meat in it. Cooked meat always lasts longer than raw. Besides, I don't really want raw meat - yuck! And if I cook with salt, even better. Cured meat practically lasts forever!
name: Leonard's notes on staying well fed

examine: This hefty jar stands about four feet in height, and has been sculpted from a resolute burnt-red clay. Its girth is fairly large, tapering in size to top and bottom.
name: a sealed clay jar

examine: A tall golden candle is crafted of the finest beeswax from the Anduin Vale. The comb-patterned candle is lightly scented with a sweet honey fragrance. The wick is protected with a thin reflective tin collar.
name: a candle

examine: The gooseberries are floating in a sticky greenish syrup. The oval berries are green and semi-transparent, with tiny seeds visible through the soft skin.
name: some sticky gooseberry preserve

examine: What once was fresh milk has now turned into something else. The liquid has started to solidify into coagulated lumps of a yellow-green cheese.
name: some curdled milk

examine: A short stem is still fastened to the berries, breaking of the smooth, round surface. The berries are dark in colour and they look very tasty indeed.
name: a number of blackberries

examine: They look very tasty indeed.
name: a handful of blueberries

examine: These are indeed strawberries. They are smaller in size than the garden variety, but what they lack in size they make up in taste. It might be that when Yavanna made wild strawberries she put forth all her skill. So delicate and subtle yet wholesome, fresh and sweet is their taste.
name: some wild strawberries

examine: These wild aggregate berries have been torn carelessly for they still have the conical bits attached to them from which they grew on the mother-shrub. Those tasty looking raspberries are of a marvellous red colour, and one wonders if they taste every bit as sweet as they look.
name: some crimson raspberries

examine: This cut of meat has been spared of the flame, but not from the hot billowing smoke rising forth from the fire. The surface has been rendered a dark tan colour, indicating it was smoked using a hardy wood.
name: a smoked piece of meat

examine: This small bunch of chanterelles contains mushrooms ranging in size from button to finger-length. Club-like stems turn smoothly into vase-shaped caps, their underside covered with thin pale folds. The tasty-looking round caps have inrolled irregular margins, and the remaining parts of the mushrooms range in colour from cream to deep yellow. A pleasant smell wafting from them bodes well for their culinary value also.
name: a bunch of chanterelles

examine: These small, dark berries look very tasty.
name: a handful of blackcurrant berries

examine: The apple is glossy, honey-coloured, and almost transparent. Looking through it at a light, you can see its core and seeds, and when it is shadowed from light, it seems to shine from the inside. Its smell is fresh, yet richer and sweeter than the smell of an ordinary apple.
name: a large yellow apple

examine: It is a broad belt made from tiny silver rings woven together.
name: a broad silver belt

examine: You see a small leather bag, ideally suited to keep slingstones. A long strip of leather has been added, so that you can wear it on your back. To get more ammunition, just wear the pouch and reveal stone.
name: a leather pouch

examine: You recognise this piece of silvery metal as a nugget of mithril, that priceless treasure which was the source of the dwarves' great wealth of old.
name: a piece of silvery metal

examine: These sleeves are crafted from rigid leather, offering solid protection for the arms. The tough material ensures durability, although it limits flexibility somewhat. The stitching appears robust, promising to withstand significant wear and tear.
name: a pair of rigid leather sleeves

examine: Measuring more than three feet in diameter, this rounded shield can defend against any number of frontal or flanking attacks. Its round rim is reinforced with steel and the face of the armour is field green in colour. The shield's crest bears a running horse, white upon green, the emblem of the House of Eorl.
name: a round shield of the Mark

examine: There is a variety of tools, including slim, flat pieces and long, thin pieces, as well as strangely hooked and flattened pieces.
name: a set of lock picks

examine: This oak crook measures about four feet from the arch of the handle to its base. Carved long ago from what had to have been a single piece of wood the wood now shows marks of weather and age.
name: a shepherd's crook

examine: This crude container has been fashioned poorly from the bladder of some unfortunate creature. It is tied together with a thin, black string, recklessly crossing back and forth over the folds of yellow-grey skin. The seams of the skin pieces are damp, a result of the shoddy worksmanship and recent leaking.
name: a smelly bladder

examine: This long, white flute was made from the lower arm bone of an Elf. While the carving has been carried out with a lot of patience and skill, a line of orkish runes on the backside makes clear of what origin the craftsman was. The flute has five holes for the fingers, and it is attached to a string of pale leather, so that it can be worn around the neck or on a belt.
name: a flute of bone

examine: Spanning the height of a small man and made of reddish-brown wood, it has a taut string tied with knots on both ends and a sturdy grip in the middle.
name: a longbow

examine: Rabbit fur lines the inside of this skullcap making it both comfortable and warm. Two small straps at the back of the cap can be tightened to ensure a snug fit, which will be useful in high winds.
name: a soft leather helmet

examine: This foul smelling bit of severed flesh is slimy, vile and very sticky. The surface is grey with some pink patches.
name: a long, sticky bit of flesh

examine: This wicked weapon is essentially a long and slender knife whose edges have been notched like a harpoon, ensuring the formation of gaping bloody wounds when ripped out of a victim.
name: a barbed fang

examine: The quarrel is made from hard wood and has a sharp head of iron. The rear end is square and has a slight notch which allows it to be used in a crossbow.
name: a bolt

examine: These excellent sleeves have been constructed from thick pieces of high quality leather sewn together using a strong brown twine. They are lined with a delicate soft fur providing the wearer with warmth and protection, whilst also allowing a great deal of flexibility.
name: a fine pair of soft leather sleeves

examine: These gloves have been constructed from a high quality leather, lined with fine rabbit fur to offer comfort as well as protection.
name: a fine pair of soft leather gloves

examine: This transparent gemstone is a topaz, of the rare blue variety. Topazes as large as this are quite difficult to cut, since they cleave easily; the jewel-smith who worked on this gem must have been quite experienced, perhaps one of the most skilled Dwarves of Khazad-dum, in order to obtain such a wondrous result.
name: a topaz

examine: A sharp and heavy spearhead, created in a silvery metal. It is almost the size of a grown man's hand and vaguely serrated along the edges. Runes are embedded along the sides of the head and where normally a shaft would be fitted is a hole, about an inch wide.
name: a glittering spearhead

examine: A scrap made from some smithing process, there is not much of it left. It shines like silver, although it is very strong for its small size.
name: a scrap of silver

examine: This faceted gemstone seems to capture the faintest glimmers of light, and to transform them into marvellous rainbows. Truly this must be the legendary adamant, harder and brighter than diamond; a jewel not made by the forces of nature, but crafted by one of the great Noldorin smiths - Celebrimbor, or perhaps Feanor himself.
name: a brilliant adamant

examine: This bracelet is made of several simple chains linked together to six settings. Three of the settings are teardrops and three are diamond-shaped, diamond and tear following each other. No clasp adorns the bracelet, thus it needs to be pulled over the hand to be worn.
name: a plain bracelet

special_abilities: It is efficient against long range spells.

examine: This bracelet is made of several simple chains linked together to six settings. Three of the settings are teardrops and three are diamond-shaped, diamond and tear following each other. No clasp adorns the bracelet, thus it needs to be pulled over the hand to be worn. The bracelet has been embedded with lustrous green emeralds.
name: a bracelet with deep green gems

special_abilities: It is efficient against long range spells.

examine: Over a hundred small rings have been linked together form a chained necklace with a small hook clasp on one side, and a pendant on the other end. On examining the chain further, it appears to be quite sturdy despite its rather diminuitive size. The pendant is shaped like a teardrop and has room for a gem to be mounted.
name: a plain pendant

special_abilities: It is efficient against long range spells.

examine: The ring is round and perfectly shaped to fit around a finger. Only a small marking can be found on the inside of the ring, a signature of the silversmith that forged it. The top of the ring features a square, silver setting with room for a gem.
name: a plain ring

special_abilities: It is efficient against long range spells.

examine: This ring, clearly designed to fit the fingers of a man, is quite heavy for its size and could be worn by creatures both larger and smaller than a man. Made of solid iron it lacks any decoration or other distinguishing features.
name: an iron ring

examine: It is thick and tan, covered with tough scales. The criss-cross formation of the black stripes, makes a diamond pattern up its length. You also notice how supple it is, perhaps the hide could be tanned and formed into a garment of some sort.
name: a long and scaly snakeskin

examine: At first sight, this amorphous chunk of metal looks like the botched result of an apprentice smelter's first attempt at making an iron ingot. A closer look at the evenly smoothed surface, however, reveals the presence of a grid of thin straight lines, faintly coloured, crossing each other at regular angles.
name: a chunk of metal

examine: This is a beautiful and delicate vase. It is made of a grey, translucent material, with smell glittery specks shining within it. The Dwarves jealously guard the secret of its making.
name: a porcelain vase

examine: This bag attaches to the saddle of a mount. It has enough room for smaller items. It is made of sturdy leather, with brass locks.
name: a saddlebag

examine: This bowl measures nearly two feet across it has clearly been made for someone of large stature. While the inside of the bowl is extremely smooth the outer side shows signs of wear. There are chips around the rim of the bowl and a small crack is beginning to form.
name: a worn clay bowl

examine: This wrist guard is made of decoratively patterned leather. The quality of the handiwork is impressive and the decorations are etched with great skill and precision. Birds aflight between two tall, luminous trees adorn the centre of the leather band. Strong cords evoking leafy vines thread two sets of aglets used to fasten the guard upon the wearer's arm. The aglets are camouflaged amidst embellishments of branches and leaves. It looks very comfortable to wear around the wrist.
name: an archer's wrist guard

examine: Warm but light, this fur appears to be a skin of a large, tawny bear. Its hairs are thick and light brown at the roots, sand-coloured in the middle and thin, light golden at the ends. The former owner of this fur must have been able to easily blend with the ground and trees in sunlit forests.
name: a tawny bear fur

examine: This shield is not exceptionally large, but it is very maneuverable. It is very light for its size, and on its front is a brilliant collage of gems and precious metals.
name: a bejewelled shield

examine: These vambraces have been masterfully forged out of steel. The reinforced shoulders are connected to a durable metal cylinder to protect the upper arm. The elbow section is made out of concentric telescoping bands that are fitted together to allow free movement without leaving a gap. The smaller metal tubes for the forearms have strong hooks to securely attach gauntlets.
name: a black pair of metal vambraces

examine: These gauntlets have been masterfully forged out of steel. The metal of the wrists flare out to overlap the armour of the forearm. There are straps to attach the gauntlets securely. The back of each knuckle on every finger is protected by thick metal, and is hinged to allow free movement of the fingers.
name: a crimson pair of metal gauntlets

examine: This pile of fur is nothing more than a pair of shoes.
name: a pair of rabbit fur shoes

examine: This conical leather helmet is joined together with two strips of stiff cowhide, and fastened with four rather dull metal studs. The rim fits rather low on your head, just above your eyebrows.
name: a fine, soft leather helmet

examine: The cap is little more than a thin piece of fabric, which has been shaped into the simplest headwear. The material is dark, and a little dirty, so it is hard to see the pattern, but it appears to be a simple check. The rim has been stiffened slightly, so that it might protect the wearer's eyes from the sun.
name: a soft cloth cap

examine: This heavy, thick metal breastplate was obviously crafted by a master armourer. It will protect its owner from all but the mightiest blows.
name: a black metal breastplate

examine: This little key is made from copper.
name: a copper key

examine: This arrow is about two feet and a half long pine shaft, but more noticeable is its finely crafted leaf-shaped tip.
name: a leaf-shaped arrow

examine: This is a large and broad belt, not only holding up the wearer's pants but also supporting his back. Its leather backing is reinforced with metal plates and studs, and ornamentation covers each one.
name: a broad girdle

examine: This buckler has a diameter of slightly more than a foot. Its most noticeable feature is a sharp metal spike at its centre which is bound to the circular wooden backing by numerous strips of brown, tanned horsehide. Two hide straps on the inner side provide a grip for the shield.
name: a spiked horsehide buckler

examine: The blouse is made from linen cloth and looks quite ordinary. Upon closer inspection, a few simple decorations along the sleeves can be spotted.
name: a black blouse

examine: This large rounded metal shield looks able to protect almost the full length of a soldier's body, when used properly. The shield's face has been painted a grassy green colour. The embossed crest portrays a golden sun blazoned upon the green background.
name: a sun-emblazoned shield

examine: This heavy, thick metal breastplate was obviously crafted by a master armourer. It will protect its owner from all but the mightiest blows.
name: a crimson metal breastplate

examine: This simple musical instrument is made of seven dried reeds of varying lengths bound together with a length of cord. Though crude, it can produce haunting melodies in skilled hands.
name: a set of reed pipes

examine: Once, long ago, it may have been a stout and sturdy chest. However, as the years have passed the wood has been bitten by frost and dried by wind, and it seems to be only barely holding on to itself. However, the ancient craftsmanship proves stronger than expected.
name: a rickety wooden chest

examine: A black fur, lined with streaks of silver, has been fashioned into a furred cloak. A few clasps can be spotted on the fur, as well as a few strings so it can be well-attached to its owner.
name: a fur-cloak with a silvery streak

examine: This large cloak is made of dark-blue cloth and is lined with soft fabric. When worn it is fastened below the neck with two long woven braids.
name: a dark-blue cloak

examine: These vambraces have been masterfully forged out of steel. The reinforced shoulders are connected to a durable metal cylinder to protect the upper arm. The elbow section is made out of concentric telescoping bands that are fitted together to allow free movement without leaving a gap. The smaller metal tubes for the forearms have strong hooks to securely attach gauntlets.
name: a crimson pair of metal vambraces

examine: A well made pair of russet coloured pants, made for years of usage by a skilled tailor.
name: a pair of reddish-brown pants

examine: These greaves are forged out of durable, polished steel plates. They cover the entire leg except for the knees, where strong, interwoven chains attach to the upper and lower leg parts. Black leather laces at the back of the greaves enable them to be adjusted to the size of the leg. An engraved set of buckles at the top allows attachment to other pieces of armour.
name: a crimson pair of metal greaves

id_details.value: twelve lauren, one celeb, and eighty busc

examine: This large hat has a wide brim that slopes downward in the front and curves upward in the back. Simple but sturdy, it was stitched together from rough pieces of leather, with a cloth hat band encircling the junction between crown and brim.
name: a brown hat

examine: The pile of fur here is a simple vest made of wolf fur.
name: a wolf fur vest

examine: This Noldorin robe is woven from the finest white wool. The sleeves and hem are elaborately stitched with golden thread.
name: a Daedeltiri robe

examine: A large number of small, neatly cut pieces of leather have been sewn together to make this armour breastplate. Covering the whole chest, the sturdy plate offers decent protection while not being too cumbersome.
name: a hardened leather breastplate

examine: A hefty iron collar, it has short, sharp spikes all the way around.
name: a spiked collar

examine: Carved out of a stave of wood slightly over three feet long, this bow had been stained a dark, almost black, colour, as if the wood had been charred in a fire. The workmanship is simple yet not crude; all lengths and proportions appear carefully measured, giving the bow a look of a swift, deadly weapon. Attached to the nocks is a dark bowstring made of a narrow strip of leather.
name: an orkish shortbow

examine: A mushroom lies here, pale brown in colour. On its cap there are white patches of skin that are loosely attached. It looks safe to eat, and seems to glow faintly.
name: a magic mushroom

examine: This brooch is a small replica of a battle axe, made of dull grey iron. It has a clasp on the back.
name: an iron brooch

examine: The shaft of this bolt is encased in metal, as is the tip which is composed entirely of metal. The shaft is hollow, which makes this type of missile light enough to travel far, but hit with more accuracy and force than its wooden equivalent.
name: a metal-cased bolt

examine: Crafted from thick wood, the design resembles the man-made wall shields, but it is clearly a lot more crude. The front is covered with Zaugurz tribal symbols of winter wolves, white bears and snow.
name: a Zaugurz shield

examine: It is a small white throwaway cup that has 'Keep MudLand tidy' written on its side and 'Quifatronic C-1000 mk I' on its bottom.
name: a cup

examine: It looks like an old glass vial, whose surface has withstood the passage of time. It is almost full of a reddish fluid, which looks like blood - but which hasn't coagulated in the meantime.
name: a vial of preserved blood

examine: This top is oval in shape, starting thin before bulging out, then rapidly diminishing to a metal point. It is painted green, with a yellow stripe running up and around it.
name: a wooden top

examine: +----------------------------+ A red sign says:        |  Cry & Co.  Coach Company  |                         |  Tharbad - Bree - Fornost  |                         +----------------------------+
name: a coach ticket

examine: When you carefully unfold the fragile, almost crumbling page, your eyes are treated with a storm of dancing ancient runes, scribbled all over. The letters continuously morph between different languages, and a slight blue glow can be noticed along the edges of the parchment.
name: a fragile parchment

examine: This long thin piece of metal is covered with small grooves, except for a handle at one end. It is useful for woodwork.
name: a metal file

examine: This wide sheet of thin, soft leather has been wrapped around an ornate rod carved of dark wood. There is no parchment enclosed within, but a large illustration, or rather a map of sorts, has been imprinted into the leather itself. A number of small crosses, scribbled with charcoal, is also visible. It seems like there used to be some writing at the bottom edge of the scroll, but the text is now unreadable due to some moisture that has made the leather blotched. A single rune, however, stands out in the lower right corner.
name: a brown leather scroll

examine: This small bottle contains a heavy-scented oil, used for anointing people or massaging.
name: a tincture

examine: This fleshy tail is covered with a moist, slimy coating; it is white in colour and the sides are flecked with silver. The tail is oval at the base, becoming more flat towards the tip.
name: a short, moist tail

examine: This boat is long and shallow in shape, masterfully built to be both light and strong. It has been painted with bright, flowing patterns and intricate elven runes that shine in hues of silver and gold and green. Two white-painted seats, one in front and one in back, have been woven from flexible reeds and attached between the walls of the skiff. Several short-handled paddles with broad, leaf-shaped blades are to be used for steering the boat.
name: a brightly painted skiff

examine: This narrow, grey skiff is constructed from a species of wood that is notably thin, strong, and buoyant. The individual planks have been put together so skilfully that it is nearly impossible to see the seams between them. It is said that the boats built by the elves of Lorien are unsinkable, albeit wayward if navigated by untrained hands. Several short-handled paddles with broad, leaf-shaped blades lie in the bottom of the craft.
name: a narrow grey boat

examine: Made of a heavy cloth, this coat could easily cover a man, sheltering him from the weather. Down the front are buttons made from brass, with the symbol of Arnor on each one.
name: a buttoned cassock

special_abilities: It is efficient against water and cold.

examine: Crafted from the finest sturdy oak, this huge wall shield garners you a protection that ranges from head to toe. Lighter than its metal counterpart, it still affords a great deal of cover from melee and missile weapons alike.
name: a large wooden wall shield

examine: This is a light steel helmet, pointed at the top.
name: a basinet

examine: It is woven of a strong thread, in a fine mesh that will ensnare the smallest fish unfortunate enough to be caught in it.
name: a fishing net

examine: The belt looks very tough, as it is made out of a long snakeskin. You notice the black stripes form a diamond pattern, and surmise that the hide once covered a large rattlesnake. Its colour is light brown, almost leading into a light grey. The scales on it are very strong and form a durable material.
name: a snakeskin belt

examine: A thick leather belt, with silver studs evenly spaced.
name: a studded leather belt

examine: This appears to have been taken from some creature, or the corpse of that creature. It is sealed, and contains some liquid.
name: a small fluid-sack

examine: This was undoubtedly once a part of some creature. It is not large, and inside you can clearly see some dark fluid.
name: a grey fluid-sack

examine: This old pickaxe is no longer of use to anyone. The head is rusty and rather blunt by long use. The handle completes the image of uselessness by being broken in two places.
name: a broken pickaxe

examine: The amulet is forged from a vibrant red metal, its surface smooth but marked with faint, ancient runes that catch the light. It feels unnaturally warm to the touch, as though alive with hidden power. Suspended from a silver chain that gleams as if untouched by time, the amulet radiates an aura both unsettling and compelling, drawing the eye.
name: a bright red amulet

examine: It is a long robe, made of a golden and silver fabric. The emblem of the guild is embroidered on its front and back.
name: a guild-guard uniform

examine: You see a beautifully knit piece of wolfskin. The wristband must have been made by a craftsman of Old.
name: a wolfskin wristband

examine: The vest is made from fine and expensive silk.
name: a plain vest

examine: They are yellow, with a greenish tint. They must have come from very small, tightly bunched flowers.
name: some yellow petals

examine: About a yard high, it is almost as wide. Intermingled with the green leaves you see long clusters of flowers, looking vaguely like a tail of some kind.
name: a bushy flowering plant

examine: This heavy chunk of ore is not very useful in its present state, but once it has been smelted a good craftsman could make good use of the metal within.
name: an iron ore fragment

examine: Despite its small size, this piece of iron ore weighs heavily in your hand.
name: a chunk of ore

examine: This is a piece of deep grey rock with some bluish-green intrusions, somewhat crystalline and at the same time powdery.
name: a chunk of copper ore

examine: This pair of gauntlets is forged from several thin pieces of steel. While the hand itself is composed of one solid piece of steel, the fingers are constructed out of several small ring-like parts that maintain the flexibility of the fingers. A metal clip allows closure of the gauntlet around the hand.
name: a pair of metal gauntlets

examine: Several plates of thin metal are attached to each other to form this piece of armour. It covers the complete arm except for the elbow, which is covered with small iron links. Leather strips encircle the vambraces, providing a way to close them around the arm. A couple of metal buckles at the ends of the vambraces enable attachment to other pieces of armour.
name: a pair of metal vambraces

examine: The light seems to play tricks with your eyes as you strain to make out the intricate design etched on the shield's surface. The shield itself is light and made of some dark metal. The fine tracery embossed upon it is dominated in the centre by a bright red lidless eye that seems to fix you in its gaze.
name: a dark shield
a map of the freehold of the Shire
a map of the Tower Hills

examine: The surface of this meat still shows traces of blood. Whether it was briefly cooked or just browned from age, it will not keep edible for long.
name: a small piece of venison

examine: The surface of this meat still shows traces of blood. Whether it was briefly cooked or just browned from age, it will not keep edible for long.
name: a small piece of swan meat

examine: The surface of this meat still shows traces of blood. Whether it was briefly cooked or just browned from age, it will not keep edible for long.
name: a small piece of squirrel meat

examine: The small piece of meat is dark red and veiny. Blood can be seen seeping from the middle and bits of white, fatty tissue are hanging off the outer edges.
name: a small piece of raw squirrel meat

examine: The small piece of meat is dark red and veiny. Blood can be seen seeping from the middle and bits of white, fatty tissue are hanging off the outer edges.
name: a small piece of raw rabbit meat

examine: The light and brown bannock looks delicious.
name: a delicious bannock

examine: It is a bright orange-red, with yellow spots covering its top. It has a sweet and alluring smell.
name: a bright red mushroom

examine: It seems this yellow comb of honey was violently crushed to a messy mixture of wax and honey.
name: a mashed honey-wax mixture

examine: This ivory coloured bulb of garlic consists of several sections. A spicy, pungent aroma, emanating from the partly crushed sections of the bulb, flows in the air around it.
name: a bulb of garlic

examine: The round raw dough needs to be cooked to be made into a brown bannock.
name: a small ball of dough

examine: The carrot is long and reddish yellow with still a few strands of green leaves attached to the top. It is still quite dirty and upon closer examination it appears as if a small creature has taken a number of bites out of the juicy carrot.
name: a carrot

examine: The spherical berries are half an inch large. Their dark violet aspect reminds you of a black cherry, but you doubt they would be that tasty.
name: some violet berries

examine: This is a large golden honeycomb with the soft sticky feel of wax, dripping with sweet honey.
name: a sticky honeycomb

examine: The surface of this onion is coloured light brown. Some small fragments of dirt are attached to the roots. The odour of this vegetable is quite noticeable.
name: an onion

examine: The plum is mostly coloured purple, with some touches of blue here and there. It is egg-shaped and about two inches in diameter.
name: a juicy plum

examine: This humpy potato is still dusty and covered with soil. Its skin is brown-red and its pulp is yellow. It can accompany meat or fish for a complete meal.
name: a potato

examine: This stem has been broken and crushed. Sap oozes from point where it has been snapped and crushed. The soggy mish-mash is shaped into a small ball.
name: a crushed stem

examine: Though light, the boat looks sturdy. It is only big enough to carry one.
name: a light boat of reeds

examine: The canoe is light and sturdy, made of teakwood. It is six feet in length, and can easily be carried by a single person if need arises.
name: a canoe

examine: This raft looks like nothing more than a couple of tree-branches lashed together.
name: a raft

examine: The leather of this scabbard has been inlaid with gold and silver designs, gracefully swirling around precious stones.
name: an ornate scabbard

examine: This bracelet is made of several simple chains linked together to six settings. Three of the settings are teardrops and three are diamond-shaped, diamond and tear following each other. No clasp adorns the bracelet, thus it needs to be pulled over the hand to be worn. The bracelet has been embedded with rubellites.
name: a bracelet with cerise gems

special_abilities: It is efficient against long range spells.

examine: This delicate bracelet is embedded with many small jades. They surround a large perfect jade of a green hue slightly darker than the smaller gems. The bracelet itself is golden and appears warm to the touch. Clearly this is work of the dwarven master smiths of old.
name: a jade bracelet

examine: Large enough to fit a giant's wrist, this bracer's surface is heavily ornate, bearing chiselled runes, geometrical shapes and inlaid spirals of bronze. Judging from the weight and colour, the bracer could be made of silver; yet it seems far harder.
name: a huge silvery bracer

examine: The glossed chunk of amber has a triangular shape to it, rounded at all ends. At a closer look at the honey-coloured amber, you can see something deep inside it, something dark, but you can't quite make out its shape.
name: a chunk of honey-coloured amber

special_abilities: When embedded, it can greatly reduce the damage from some magical attacks.

examine: This clear, faceted gem plays wondrous tricks with the light it receives: depending on external conditions, its colour changes from bluish-green to orange to purple-red. It seems as if the gem were a living creature itself, waking up and sleeping as time passes.
name: a corberyl

examine: This small gem is a deep glossy black, with a few bands of white and pale grey sweeping across its surface. It is highly polished, and seems to both absorb and reflect light at the same time.
name: an onyx

special_abilities: When embedded, it can be used to weaken an enemy.

examine: Cut into a a multifaceted teardrop, the spinel shines with a mirror finish of pitch-black brilliance. The base of the gem is smooth, while the point at the top of the teardrop is as sharp as a needle and as strong as steel.
name: a pitch-black spinel

special_abilities: When embedded, it can be used to shroud yourself in shadows.

examine: This large skin looks well constructed. It is made of two leather hides that have been thoroughly sewn together with strips of leather. The nozzle, which can be opened easily to quench one's thirst, is closed shut with a cork that is tethered to the side of the bag.
name: a large skin

examine: The bottle of dark-brown glass is wider at the base then at the top and could contain all sorts of liquids. A big cork seals the bottle.
name: a bottle

examine: This shrub is around three feet high, and is clearly an evergreen. The leaves on its branches are bright green, lacy, delicate near the top, and lobed near the bottom. There are clusters of small, spherical and ribbed seeds which emit an unpleasant odour.
name: a bright green shrub

examine: A simple pipe, though it looks as though it was made with great care. There are no ornate decorations, but the smooth texture and curves are of great quality. The potter that made this pipe must blow a few smoke rings in his spare time.
name: a clay pipe

examine: The blouse is made from linen cloth and looks quite ordinary. Upon closer inspection, a few simple decorations along the sleeves can be spotted.
name: a white blouse

examine: These are simple robes, made for everyday wear by those who favour this kind of apparel. The fabric of the robes is a rough and lacking in any patterns to distinguish, while the appearance of loose threads and small wear patterns to the cloth suggests that the robe has been washed many a time.
name: a plain robe

examine: This helmet has some mean looking spikes mounted on the front. It looks like it could provide the wearer with good protection against all kinds of violence.
name: a spiked metal helmet

examine: The sheer size of this huge shield affords you a wide range of protection, if you have the strength to wear it without overly fatiguing yourself. Thick leather straps are riveted to the inside allowing you to grip the handle enough to lift this monumental shield.
name: a large metal wall shield

examine: An orkish shield, it is designed for the regular troops to fight with. Light and not too cumbersome in size, it provides protection without sacrificing mobility. The face of the shield is blackened to avoid reflections, while the inner surface has a crude leather covering. On the sable face is the crude design of a red skull, the effigy of the Ohurk-uai tribe.
name: a red-skull shield

examine: This round shield is certainly gruesome. From the centre projects a large and sharp, although rusty, spike. The spike is bathed in dried blood and gore from unfortunate opponents, and in fact the entire shield has many layers of blood encrusted upon it. The shield has apparently never been washed or cleaned in any way, and it would be impossible to remove the 'decorations'.
name: a spiked shield

examine: Crafted from sturdy oak, this wall shield offers you a moderate range of protection. Leather straps riveted to the inside provide you with a sturdy grip, allowing you to lift the shield.
name: a wooden wall shield

examine: A small apron can be worn as a protection so other clothes do not dirty. It has served that purpose very well, as many stains of varying sizes and colours cover it almost completely, effectively hiding its original colour.
name: a dirty apron

examine: The cloak is a light, grey, hooded cloak with a red circle on the back and on the hood.
name: a fine grey cloak

id_details.value: fifty lauren, three celeb, and sixty busc

examine: This dark fur is composed of black hairs which, when observed closely, are somewhat reflective against the light. It is not very heavy, but the skin is surprisingly tough. It is slightly warm to the touch, as though imbued with its original owner's strength.
name: a black warg fur

examine: The robe is made of a heavy and rough black fabric, which would probably irritate the skin of an unaccustomed wearer. Still, it is a good protection against the adverse elements. On the back, painted in red, the lidless eye of Sauron stares menacingly.
name: a black and red robe

examine: This hat seems very warm, as it is made out of rough wool. Soft enough not to make it uncomfortable, yet strong enough not to wear out quickly. It is tightly woven, guaranteed to keep out the elements of wind and cold.
name: a grey wool hat

examine: This heavy fur is much lighter in colour than usual wolf fur, it is nearly white and has a dark stripe running along the back. Its original function was to protect the wolf against scratches, bites and other damage.
name: a white wolf fur

examine: This large bow is fashioned of ironwood, being very sturdy in its construction. The bow is bound, and supported by thick straps of leather to the large crosspiece of ironwood. A crank is fashioned to the end of the bow, enabling the user to pull the bow back to a loading position. Bolts are launched by the release lever on the underside of the bow. Such a weapon is designed to deliver its missile to a target with great amounts of force. It is currently not loaded.
name: a crossbow

examine: These greaves are forged out of durable, polished steel plates. They cover the entire leg except for the knees, where strong, interwoven chains attach to the upper and lower leg parts. Black leather laces at the back of the greaves enable them to be adjusted to the size of the leg. An engraved set of buckles at the top allows attachment to other pieces of armour.
name: a fine pair of metal greaves

id_details.value: twelve lauren, one celeb, and eighty busc

examine: This heavy, thick metal breastplate was obviously crafted by a master armourer. It will protect its owner from all but the mightiest blows.
name: a fine metal breastplate

examine: It is a small and frail mushroom, which partially crumbles into a greenish dust as soon as you touch it.
name: a sickly green mushroom

examine: The patch of moss glows in the shadow with a yellow-green light.
name: a patch of phosphorescent moss

examine: The shield is made from metal of some kind. It is a good compromise between a large, cumbersome metal shield and a lighter, yet much smaller shield.
name: a metal shield

examine: The vial is partially filled with a dark violet liquid, in which partially crushed berries can be seen.
name: a dark violet vial

special_abilities: It contains oil, poisoned with level five poison that would last for four hours.

examine: Strange glyphs have been drawn on a now crumpled and dirty note. Their meaning is difficult to understand, but they could describe a medical formula of some sort.
name: a dirty note

examine: This fine arrow has been made from light ash-wood, well renowned for its qualities of durability and strength.
name: an ash arrow

examine: It is a shorter quarrel than most, with the vanes in green and orange. Along the sides are slight grooves, made of perhaps darker wood or stained darker. The head is smaller than the other quarrels, but three small holes puncture it.
name: a blackened bolt

special_abilities: It is efficient against Dwarves and Elves.

examine: This bow has been carefully crafted out of a single solid piece of wood. The surface of the wood is perfectly smooth, but has been neither stained nor painted, its only ornament the fine lines of the growth rings. Slightly over three feet long, this elegant weapon bears a silvery bowstring.
name: an elven shortbow

examine: According to the small, flat dents and sharp corners in the blade, the key seems to be hammered and filed from a single piece of iron. The key has a strange twist at the end of the shaft, which leaves the blade upside down compared to the handle.
name: a twisted iron key

examine: Finely wrought and with delicate engravings, this key seems to signify great status. However, ages of disuse have formed a blackish layer over the entire key, and any flesh it touches quickly becomes numb.
name: a silvery key

examine: The workmanship is strange, heralding back from the northern realms. It has been blackened by the centuries, yet it has not rusted in the least. Strangely, it is very cold to the touch.
name: an old iron key

examine: The key is four inches long and is totally rusted.
name: a rusted key

examine: This key is made of black metal. Silver inlays form small lines from the handle all the way to the blade where they split and follow the edges.
name: a black and silver key

examine: This axe was forged from very dark iron. The blade produces a rough impression and is covered with slight dents, deep scratches, old blood, and the occasional spot of rust. The edge is somewhat jagged and the only part of the weapon that is well-tended - and thus quite shiny and very, very sharp.
name: a large Zaugurz axe

examine: These petals are red and pink, and still hold a potent and beautiful scent.
name: some red petals

examine: Plates of thin, steel-like metal are bent and mended to resemble the shape of a torso. It exists out of two pieces, a front and a back, that can be attached to each other by leather bands. Metal buckles are pinched to the neck, the shoulders and the lower belly, allowing attachment for other pieces of metal armour.
name: a metal breastplate

examine: These calf-high boots are made from thick, inflexible leather. They offer superior protection at the expense of some comfort.
name: a pair of rigid leather boots

examine: These trousers have been constructed from thin leather pieces joined together by a set of slightly thicker knee guards. They have also been lined with a soft delicate fur of dubious nature allowing the wearer scarce protection on a cold winter day, whilst be granted a great deal of flexibility.
name: a pair of soft leather trousers

examine: This breastplate is made from thick, inflexible leather, meticulously crafted to provide maximum protection. Its rigid nature offers substantial defense, though it restricts the wearer's mobility.
name: a rigid leather breastplate

examine: This round candy is white coloured, with bright red stripes encircling it. It has a minty smell.
name: a small piece of hard candy

examine: The crumbly biscuit is made of tightly pressed flour, which is kept together with a tiny bit of milk and honey. It is dry and nutricious, which makes it useful to carry on long journeys in the wilderness.
name: a small biscuit of cram

examine: This pie is fully covered with dough, but exudes a distinct smell of pork. The crust of the pie is flaky and unsweetened. The meat of this pie is seasoned with salt and pepper, as well as other herbs and spices.
name: a pork-pie

examine: You see a small golden-brown tart, sprinkled generously with cinnamon and filled with blackberry jam which is oozing from the cracks in its crust.
name: a blackberry tart

examine: This delicate pastry shell is filled to the top with a mixture of cut apples and other juicy ingredients.
name: an apple tart

examine: A straw pallet lies here, looking very warm and inviting. It is about an inch thick, and is malleable enough to mould to the contours of your body quite well, providing some insulation against the cold.
name: a straw pallet

examine: The box has been expertly assembled, and the top hinges perfectly with the rest. The sides have been carven into a relief of a great feast, and the front has a decoration inlaid with great skill.
name: a large wooden box

examine: The outer surface of the silver goblet is polished to be perfectly smooth. It catches light, and disperses across its surface. The inside of the goblet is a slightly darker, yet still highly finished silver with a crimson hue.
name: a silver goblet

examine: This special type of harness is made entirely of leather except for the metal buckle that is used to adjust for the height of the wearer, and two metal rungs at each end of the baldric. The baldric is meant solely as a holder of long bladed weapons, such as two-handed swords rather than a protecter like a normal sheath. The baldric is worn on the back and uses the rungs as holders for the sword.
name: a leather baldric

examine: This is your typical sized wine glass. The wine is deep red in colour and looks quite tasty. Its rich full aroma tempts your tastebuds. You should probably have a sip now. I'm sure many more will follow.
name: a wine glass

examine: This harness is built to hold larger weapons than a normal harness. It is meant to be worn on the back and has several leather straps to adjust for height. There are metal rungs attached to the harness that are meant to further secure the weapon.
name: a sturdy weapon harness

examine: This combination of leather straps and bands is shaped to hold a larger weapon, like an axe. Some strings can be used to fasten this harness to a belt.
name: a weapon harness

examine: You notice intricate runes woven onto a strangely light-weight ring.
name: a ring

special_abilities: It is efficient against long range spells.

examine: Measuring three inches in diameter, this bronze cloakpin bears the signet of Rohan - a fiery sun engraved upon the centerpiece. The pin has been cleverly crafted to securely fasten to almost any cloak.
name: a sun-emblazoned cloakpin

examine: The necklace is made of the skeletal remains of various creatures. You recognise the teeth of a boar, the skull of a squirrel, and finger bones of a humanoid. Others look so alien to your eyes that you can't even imagine what creatures they come from. The bones are strung along a twisted rope apparently made from the inner organs of some unfortunate animal.
name: a necklace of bones

examine: A long silver tube with several holes cut along its length.
name: a shiny flute

examine: This cup of polished gold is embossed with the sigil of the House of Durin: a hammer surmounted by a crown with three stars.
name: a golden cup

examine: The large cup is meant large enough to be held with two hands. It is fashioned from a bright silver alloy and set with lapis lazuli and sapphires arranged in a floral motif.
name: a jewel-encrusted goblet

examine: This beautiful little box is crafted from solid cherry wood, rich in colour with a smooth finish. Tiny white gemstones line the top of the box just below the lid, while slightly larger dark green stones border the base. Upon the lid, set in the very centre, lies a dark-blue sapphire, sparking with delight.
name: a small jewel-box

examine: This elegant belt was probably never meant to be worn in battle, although it is far from fragile. It seems to be formed from a silver mesh to which somehow many lustrous pearls and amber crystals have been affixed.
name: a belt of pearls and crystals

examine: This fine golden ring glitters with a bright shine. It is engraved with many wonderful patterns. It is composed of three pure golden bands that encircle each other intertwining into a spiral.
name: a gold ring

examine: Clean straight lines converge with curves in this striking sterling silver ring. Several fine icons are skilfully carved in the silver, creating a fascinating mixture of both sturdiness and beauty.
name: a ring of silver

examine: It's a plain silver wedding band.
name: a silver wedding ring

examine: A nice small ring with inscriptions inside.
name: an engagement ring

examine: The jade is carefully cut into the shape of the trunk of a tree not more than two inches high. A light and solid metal pierces through the jade, forming the necklace and the clasp. The crown is of thin silvery bands and its blue leaves of another metal, giving it a very beautiful and desirable impression.
name: a jade amulet

examine: Carefully crafted, this small and delicate golden brooch is shaped into the likeness of a mallorn leaf. The brooch is exquisitely detailed, giving the illusion of a just fallen spring leaf, glittering in golden splendour.
name: a mallorn-leaf brooch

examine: This small, finely shaped brooch of silver is created in the form of a splendid sword, sharp and finely crafted. The intention of the small brooch is to keep a soldier's cloak fastened together, sheltering him from the wind and the rain. The sword itself is a fine broadsword, its blade having a thin inlaid golden thread, with a small rune carved in the hilt.
name: a sword-shaped brooch

examine: This is a smallish, round piece of solid metal, that shines like silver but is heavier and stronger. The oval-shaped pin has been cleverly crafted to securely fasten a cloak of almost any size.
name: a silver cloakpin

examine: Suspended by a fine, yet strong, chain, it is reasonably heavy. The metal is tarnished, and dully reflects any light, adding to it a bronze hue. A strange design has been carved into the front of the medallion, and on the back you can decipher some writings.
name: a bronze medallion

examine: This finely wrought necklace seems dwarven in origin. The delicate links have been forged to intertwine with small gems: rubies, emeralds, sapphires, and diamonds, which add to the lustre of this valuable piece of art and jewellery.
name: a golden necklace

examine: Delicate links of gold form a light chain of about sixteen inches in length. At the midpoint of the chain is set a small, green emerald giving off a heavy aura.
name: an emerald pendant

examine: A gleaming bracelet made of the truest silver offers no sign of age or damage. Intricate patterns are finely inlaid onto its otherwise flawless surface. Never hot or cold to the touch, it seems to possess a quality that distinguishes it from other metals.
name: a fine silver bracelet

examine: Even though it is made of silver, it seems constructed sturdily. The metal has been moulded into a flowing, almost wave-like shape, reminiscent of underwater currents or wind.
name: a silver bracer

examine: It is a very nice bracelet indeed, carefully crafted in an old traditional way.
name: a small bracelet

examine: This small multi-faceted gem is a deep violet in colour. It is of an ideal cut and size to be fitted into rings or necklaces, whatever is needed by the gem smith.
name: an amethyst

examine: This heavy bar has been carefully moulded, allowing it to be easily transported.
name: a bar of gold

examine: This is an intricately shaped cloakpin made of strong steel. It has been decorated with black and white enamel, displaying a blazing S-rune against a dark background. Despite its lordly appearance, the pin seems equally fitting for the thick cloak of a traveller.
name: an enamelled cloakpin

examine: You see a tiny, sparkling diamond, reflecting the light from all around like a heavenly rainbow.
name: a beautiful diamond

examine: This faceted gem bears a deep green hue, and in the light shines brightly. Each side of the gem is perfectly aligned with the others, making this gem one of quality and value.
name: a lustrous green emerald

examine: Deep sparkling maroon, this garnet is unusually large and beautiful. It is also likely to be quite valuable.
name: a large garnet

id_details.value: six lauren, two celeb, and fifty busc

examine: This delicate musical instrument represents the height of Dwarven manufacture. The strings are formed from filaments of pure silver, somehow stretched impossibly thin, and plucking them results in a chorus of beautiful sounds.
name: a golden harp

examine: Although heavy, and gold, this nugget contains many impurities. With some care and skill, however, it could be refined to pure gold.
name: a nugget of gold

id_details.value: one lauren, seven celeb, and fifty busc

examine: This is a small, lumpy piece of metal. Its lustre and colour denote it as silver.
name: a silver nugget

examine: This large ruby would fit nicely into your hand. It has been cut by some very skilled craftsman and its sides are perfectly symmetrical. The ruby glows in a mysterious red light; a closer look at the inside reveals a million small rays and sparks of red, which are reflected and broken more often than there are glowing sparks in a great fire.
name: a red ruby

examine: This is a small, prismatic stone with a dark-green surface that dimly reflects the light. It is a beryl, an elven stone, one of the tokens that the elven folk use as signs. For those that know what to look for, it can be easily spotted, but its faint gleam will not be enough to catch the attention of the casual passer-by.
name: a small, green stone

special_abilities: When embedded, it can be used to create a temporary sanctum.

examine: Within this jewel, you can see a fire dancing as if it was living. Although the fire is coloured blue from the gem, it is obvious it is the light in the room, trapped within the opal's crystal.
name: a lustrous opal

examine: This quartzite has a glossy finish to it, with most of the stone being a brilliant white. At a closer glance, there are slender bevels of dark grey within the centre of the stone that branch into finer traces of a lighter grey until the swirls of colour fade away.
name: a polished white quartzite

special_abilities: When embedded, it can be used to call upon the Valar.

examine: The gemstone is golden to red-brown with a silky lustre. It is chatoyant, as a few sharply defined bands of light show across the stone due to aligned inclusions.
name: a tiger's eye

examine: This large apple has a deep red colour with a bit of a shine and a short firm brown stem. It looks very tasty from the outside.
name: an apple

examine: These large purple grapes look quite tasty. Saving them for later would be a bad idea, since they are quite fresh now. You would not want them to lose any of their fantastic flavour. You should definitely sit down and have a snack.
name: some juicy grapes

examine: Tapered on one side to better fit your grip, this large wooden torch is specially designed to burn for hours on the fuel applied on the end of it.
name: a torch

examine: This large barrel is constructed of carefully-fitted wood bound together with iron hoops.
name: a large barrel

examine: Assembled from thick wooden planks and held together by two strong iron hoops, this barrel has a scent of beer floating around it.
name: a stout barrel

examine: The wood of the barrel is coarse and aged. Three hoops of iron, one in the middle and one placed around each top and bottom hold it together.
name: an oak barrel

examine: This miniature barrel is made of many straight pieces of wood which are wrapped around the middle with two metal bands. A solid wooden lid is tightly secured over the top.
name: a small barrel

examine: This is a large, frosty mug. From one side sprouts a sturdy handle.
name: a pint

examine: The bottle itself is plain, just an ordinary brown container. From inside the bottle, whether empty or full, comes the aroma of a stout fermented beverage. The tales of Dwarven ale say that it is a strong brew, and from the smell you can only agree.
name: a big bottle

examine: Made from dark-brown clay, this ceramic piece is quite heavy for a bottle. Its base is large and wide and gets thinner towards the neck. The bottle is kept sealed by a large cork.
name: a dark bottle

examine: A fine layer of dust coats this bottle, and the label proclaims it is of distinctive vintage, aged handsomely.
name: a fine bottle

examine: It is an old green bottle.
name: a firebreather

examine: The flagon is made of a clear glass. Rainbows play in it as it catches light.
name: a flagon

examine: This small rectangular container made of refined silver, has corners carefully rounded so it may be worn on a belt without snagging cloth or skin. A small silver cap made to cover the carefully etched spout is attached by a thin silver rope chain.
name: an aged silver flask

examine: This is a large jug made of clear glass, with a handle near the neck that allows it to be easily carried.
name: a large glass jug

examine: It is a mug of fine porcelain, with a golden lid.
name: a beer mug

examine: This cylindrical container is mainly used to hold liquids. It can be carried about by its handle and is made of poor metal. Its many dents imply it has been handled carelessly in the past.
name: a dented pail

examine: It is a small, simple chest made out of wood.
name: a simple chest

examine: This shrub is around three feet high, and is clearly an evergreen. On each of the branches, which cover a significant area around the base of the shrub, there grow fragrant leaves. Each leaf is approximately two inches long and oval. They are velvety, with a grey-green colour, and grow off of long stalks.
name: an evergreen shrub

examine: These bleached bones, covered in all sorts of dirt, used to belong to some humanoid. All flesh has withered away from the bones quite some time ago, and they are now beginning to crumble.
name: a skeleton

examine: This old and beaten satchel seems able to hold a good amount with ease. It is equipped with a leather strap which allows you to wear it over your shoulder.
name: a leather satchel

examine: This coarsely stitched sack of sturdy miscellaneous fabric patches can be slung over a shoulder for the hauling of daily goods. Its generous size enables the user to tie it shut at the opening with the excess material.
name: a large sack

examine: The bag is full of crude stone and metal tools to cut and grind herbs and other ingredients, mix them and distil their juices. The smell of the rotting leftovers from the previous brew still hangs in the air around the bag.
name: a crude-looking bag

examine: Comprised almost entirely of leather, this small sack can be used to safely store a large amount of coins out of the reach of others. A single leather tie around the top of the bag allows for easy and secure closing.
name: a moneybag

examine: The saddle is made of a dark brown leather, with two adjustable stirrups and a wide cinch which fastens with a simple buckle.
name: a leather saddle

special_abilities: It is efficient against long range spells.

examine: Made from several narrow pieces of wood, this small box is a handy container for little items. The box has a lid that can be closed firmly to protect stored articles.
name: a small box

examine: It is very soft to touch and the hair seems to shimmer in a light brown. The fur is relatively small and darker streaks run along its outer edges.
name: a soft pelt

examine: A large bundle of ripe hay, harvested and tied up into a practical bale. Spanning about two times two feet and about a foot high, the dried bale is a considerable mass of food for livestock, ready to be stored for harsher times.
name: a bale of hay

examine: The contents of the bowl have a very tender appearance although it does not look like meat of superior quality if you eye it critically. Instead the cook must have found some way to soften the meat up during the cooking process. Should one try to catch its smell the suspicion which arises from fine stains on the meat would quickly turn into certainty as the smell has an unmistakable touch: this ragout must have been cooked for quite a while in beer. Surely this would make a great gift when visiting a dwarf, but it also will impress most other people with its taste.
name: a bowl of meat ragout

examine: This is a huge orange pumpkin, covered with vertical insets. The remains of crushed, rotten leaves stick onto its wide bottom and its staggering size is sure to draw attention to it.
name: a large pumpkin

examine: The soup is made from a smashed pumpkin which seems to have been carefully cleared of all pips. Here and there are a few tiny pieces of pumpkin swimming around in the soup, but most of it is homogenously creamy. It has a golden-yellow colour, indicating that the pumpkin used for it was very ripe, and the smell arising from it confirms this impression. Although this meal is not among the most difficult to create, it looks and smells flavoursome.
name: a portion of creamy pumpkin soup

examine: This appears to be a compilation of recipes. The writing is very familiar, making it appear more of a personal collection than a professional book. Many of the recipes have become illegible due to various reasons, such as water stains, ink smudges and some being coated by dried bits of food. One page near the end has been ripped out.
name: a cooking book

examine: This beautiful little box is crafted from solid cherry wood, rich in colour with a smooth finish. Tiny white gemstones line the top of the box just below the lid, while slightly larger dark green stones border the base. Upon the lid, set in the very centre, lies a dark-blue sapphire, sparking with delight. The box is open.
name: an inscribed wooden box

examine: This comb is made of carved animal horn, and the handle is covered in gold. Numerous runes have been engraved into the golden handle indicating this comb was crafted in the Iron Hills, where combs like these are greatly prized. Often, Dwarven beard-combs are inlaid with gems and bear seals of the house of the owner; prized family heirlooms handed down from father to son over many generations.
name: a Dwarven beard-comb

examine: This pair of drums is crudely fashioned with mismatched pieces of wood. Skin from a humanoid, still reeking of dead flesh, has been stretched across them. The drums make a hollow noise of terrible pitch, which resounds effectively enough that it can be heard for miles around.
name: a pair of orkish war-drums

examine: A medium sized horn has been hollowed out and fashioned to emit sound when blown at its tip. The horn has been shod in metal to prevent it from breaking and a strap has been attached at both ends.
name: a hunting horn
