examine: The lute is perhaps three feet long, with a long, flat neck comprising of the most of the length. The bottom is a hemisphere, with the lute-strings attached to the flat side, and a hole beneath the strings. Several tuning keys are on the head.
name: a lute

examine: This biscuit is bigger than a usual one. The baking has given the biscuit its brown colour and it will remain edible for many days and may replace a frugal meal.
name: a large biscuit

examine: This large loaf of white bread has a thick brown crust and smells faintly of flour.
name: a loaf of bread

examine: A small cake which is seasoned with different seeds, it smells delightful and is light and fluffy in texture.
name: a seed-cake

examine: Soft deer leather and suede make the little sack comfortably light and simple to wear. Small loops on the back are designed to thread onto most belts with ease. A little flap closure protects the contents adequately, when secured.
name: a belt pouch

examine: The blouse is made from linen cloth and looks quite ordinary. Upon closer inspection, a few simple decorations along the sleeves can be spotted.
name: a plain blouse

examine: This dress is stitched from cotton and has been patched with several pieces of linen. It looks like the belongings of a commoner or peasant.
name: a soft plain dress

examine: A brown and white goat gave her skin for this jacket. The seams and design of the jacket are crude and purely functional. This garment was made for cold nights out in the wilderness.
name: a goat skin jacket

examine: These are simple robes, made for everyday wear by those who favour this kind of apparel. The fabric of the robes is a rough and lacking in any patterns to distinguish, while the appearance of loose threads and small wear patterns to the cloth suggests that the robe has been washed many a time.
name: a black robe

examine: The only protection this cap offers is against a chilly morning breeze. It is made of many coloured silk pieces. The rich silk shimmers slightly and two thin strings can be used to secure the cap on the head.
name: a plain silk cap

examine: This large hat has a wide brim that slopes downward in the front and curves upward in the back. Simple but sturdy, it was stitched together from rough pieces of leather, with a cloth hat band encircling the junction between crown and brim.
name: a plain hat

examine: Made of fine velvet and cotton, this cap boasts bright and cheerful colours. From its top, several long, tube-like strands of cloth dangle, and upon each a single bell has been fastened. Called the liripipe in some cultures, this is surely only for jesters and fools.
name: a jester's cap

examine: This delicate white cloak was woven by the Noldor craftsmen of old. Thinner than parchment, the cloak almost seems to resonate with a strange glory. The spirit of the ancient Noldor can almost be felt deep within the warm fabric.
name: a sacred cloak

examine: You see a fairly long piece of cured leather, with an iron buckle attached to one end.
name: a plain leather belt

examine: Long and sleek, this piece of silk is shiny and smooth to the touch.
name: a plain silken sash

examine: The arrow is laced with a mithril lining, but more noticeable is its bright shining silver tip that has a glowing hue about it.
name: a silver-tipped arrow

id_details.value: one lauren, twelve celeb, and fifty busc

examine: This large bracket fungus has grown horizontally from the piece of decaying wood it has been feeding upon. Its round disc-like body is eight inches in diameter and is painted a flourescent orange colour in the centre. This vivid colour fades with the numerous concentric rings that show the seasons of its growth and at its rim the fungus has a pallid yellow hue.
name: an orange bracket fungus

examine: It is a man-sized plant with very finely dissected leaves and large umbels of small, white flowers. Flowers and leaves are borne on a sturdy stem, and the top of the root is visible at ground level.
name: a hemlock plant

examine: It is a beautiful plant, with a long, slender stem, sword-shaped leaves and a small number of big, bright yellow flowers. It sprouts from a heavy rhizome.
name: a swamp iris

examine: The dried and crumbled pieces of Halfling's Leaf are very small and have a light to dark brown colour, some of them nearly black. The weed does seem to smell only lightly, yet if it is crushed, the scent becomes strong and aromatic.
name: some pipe-weed

examine: It is long, with many bumps. It smells distinctly like vanilla.
name: a long, scented, brown bean

examine: Looking into this waxed paper bag, you see a small amount of a reddish-brown powder. It has a fine texture and is pungent in odour.
name: a bag of cinnamon

examine: A daisy-like flower raises atop a dark green plant with stiff, bristly hairs and lance-shaped leaves. It has long pale to deep purple spreading rays, drooping around a prominent fluffy red centre. The whole plant emits a faint, aromatic scent.
name: a purple flower with a fluffy red centre

examine: This delicate flower is less than an inch across with seven very bright white petals surrounding a cluster of tiny yellow stamens.
name: a bright white flower

examine: It is a cluster of purplish-pink flowers that are shaped like large grapes.
name: a cluster of purplish-pink flowers

examine: The flower is under ten inches tall, with a wide-petaled purple bloom. The leaves, growing at its base, are wide and near three inches long, and several large bulbs grow off of slender stalks.
name: a short flower, with a purple bloom

examine: Half a dozen bright orange flowers with yellow centres cling to the end of a single long green stem covered in short, stiff hairs.
name: a cluster of bright orange flowers

examine: They are small and white, with a yellow stamen. From them comes a very heavy and sweet smell.
name: a handful of fragile flowers

examine: A single long stem branches out into several tips, each one of which ends in a bright yellow flower. The stem is over two feet long, but each flower is less than half an inch across.
name: a many-branched stem of bright yellow flowers

examine: These brightly coloured flowers look like crinkled sheer silk. The orange- red petals have opened out until the blossom is almost flat, exposing the darker, almost black blotches which can be seen toward the base of each.
name: some orange-red flowers

examine: The remaining stem of this flower is about a foot long, much shorter than the orginal length indicated by the size of the sparkling yellow head. The flower is beautifully balanced, symmetrically displaying its golden petals.
name: a tall yellow iris

examine: A slightly sharp, very fresh scent floats up, especially when the leaves are bruised. Dark green, slender, and tapering to a point, they are also slightly wrinkled.
name: a bundle of fresh-scented leaves

examine: The coriander leaves differ in shape. Some are broadly lobed, others slender and feathery. The small berries smell a bit of anise.
name: several splayed leaves

examine: It is actually just the flower of the plant, the stem and roots being hidden underwater, and the leaves being not attractive. It has soft, delicate whitish-pink petals with long stamens that shed a shining gold pollen. The flower also has a sweet perfume which makes you feel dizzy.
name: a water lily

examine: The bright green inviting colour of this nettle bush belies its true nature. Its pointed deeply toothed leaves and narrow three-span tall stems are covered with long stinging hairs, as well as short bristly ones. Nettles feel most at home in wet, wooded areas, but they are mostly known for the sting of their hairs and bristles, their rumoured medicinal uses - their only redeeming quality.
name: a stinging nettle

examine: A delicate flower sits here, looking as if it could fall apart if touched yet surviving the occasional strong gust of wind. The petals are a deep violet in the centre, surrounded by white borders. The fragrance of the orchid is light and ephemeral.
name: a violet orchid

examine: This sack smells heavily of spices. It is made of linen and contains a large amount of slightly crushed black peppercorns. Examining it this closely makes your nose itch.
name: a sack of pepper

examine: The petals are white, and slightly yellow. They seem to have been broken from larger petals. A faint and pleasant scent still surrounds them.
name: some white petals

examine: This mass of vegetal material has been obtained by crushing and mixing all the parts of a plant. It is wet and sticky and there can easily some stems and leaves be discerned.
name: a sticky mass of stems, leaves and sap

examine: The stem is about three feet tall, and is covered with fine hairs. Its lance- shaped leaves are about six inches long, growing in opposing pairs, and one of these is broken, exuding some pale sap. A cluster of tiny, pale pink flowers tops the stalk of this upright plant.
name: a slender flowering plant

examine: The petals are white, with a slight darkening to blue at one end. A very subtle scent is associated with them.
name: some bluish-white petals

examine: This plant is under a yard tall, and reasonably slender. At its base grow opposing pairs of leaves, and up long stalks bulbous white flowers sprout. The bases of the petals are slightly bluish.
name: a slender plant

examine: They are grey-blue, lightening to pink at the centre of one end.
name: some grey petals

examine: It grows to the height of a man's chest, with pairs of opposing, serrated leaves. The flowers are grey-blue, fading to a pink near the stem.
name: a tall, grey-green plant

examine: These leaves are very slender and have retained their colour even though they have been picked. They give off a faint scent of rosemary.
name: several needlelike leaves

examine: Its pine-scented evergreen branches reach nearly three feet. They are covered in needlelike leaves, and are dotted with small, pale blue flowers. The stems cascade about the ground.
name: a woody, many-stemmed plant

examine: Its branches bear short and thin leaves, of which there are plenty. Some branches hang low near the ground, and from all of the leaves an appetizing aroma comes.
name: a woody, stemmed plant

examine: This moss is much darker than most varieties, appearing nearly black in some places. It has an odd, almost oily sheen that seems to both absorb and reflect light simultaneously.
name: some dark-green moss

examine: The grey-brown cardamom powder emits a strong flavor. Only small amounts of it are needed to spice up dishes. A few darker dots, remains of the seeds, can be spotted in the fine powder.
name: some grey-brown powder

examine: This is a small pile of a very fine powder. It emits a distinctive, pungent frangrance. The powder is dark red, almost brown in colour.
name: some pungent red powder

examine: This is a long, brown-coloured reed between four and five feet long. The stem is about three-quarters of an inch thick at the bottom and tapers slightly towards the top end. The inside of the reed is hollow and has a feathery appearance, while the walls are spongy, but seem to be quite strong.
name: a long hollow stem

examine: About the shape and size of a carrot, this pale rhizome, with crinkled flesh also bears numerous tiny rootlets. But what is most distinctive about it is its strong smell, which could easily earn it a name such as phew plant.
name: a foul-smelling root

examine: It is composed of coarse granules of a translucent white substance. You gather that it is salt, as it has a distinct odour and feel. Perhaps its origin is Cardolan, a region south of the Shire that is known for its salt exporting.
name: a chunk of salt

examine: This shrub is more bush-like, with no central stalk. The leaves on each stem are opposing, and stalkless. Overall, this shrub is under a foot in height, but spreads out to almost a foot in diameter.
name: a many-branched shrub

examine: The mistletoe is an attractive plant with small waxy berries and light green fleshy leaves along its vine.
name: a small vine sprig

examine: It is small, but contains a thick stem. On its leaves are small burrs which stick to clothing and fur. At the top is a small flower with five yellow petals.
name: a tough green weed

examine: It is a small plant with long, arrow-shaped leaves. It has a hairy stem with a few flowers near its top.
name: a small plant, with long leaves

examine: Its stem is square and purplish, with fine hair. Sporadically another stem sprouts from the main one, or a clump of small, oval leaves and small lavender flowers grows from the end of a stem.
name: a thin, hairy plant

examine: This is a brownish stable ticket. Across the back of it, someone has written "a trained horse with a leather saddle".
name: a ticket for a trained horse

examine: This is a brownish stable ticket. Across the back of it, someone has written "a warhorse Naurroch with a leather saddle".
name: a ticket for a warhorse

examine: This is a brownish stable ticket. Across the back of it, someone has written "a cat Ashcat".
name: a ticket for a cat

examine: This is a brownish stable ticket. Across the back of it, someone has written "a pack horse with a leather saddle".
name: a ticket for a pack horse

examine: This is a brownish stable ticket. Across the back of it, someone has written "a horse of the Rohirrim with a leather saddle".
name: a ticket for a horse of the Rohirrim

examine: Small, brown, wrinkled spheres, they give off a strong mint-like smell. These exotic spices could not have been grown from around here.
name: several cloves

examine: The shape of this root is rather odd. One thick root stem sprouts several smaller stringy roots which form what could be the limbs of a man.
name: a man-like root

examine: They are round, yet somewhat irregular. They are scaly, aromatic, and approximately an eighth of an inch in radius.
name: a cluster of hard, round, black berries

examine: These petals have been removed from the plant and have carefully been dried. Their colour is pink-lilac and they diffuse a strong, distinctive scent.
name: some sweet-smelling dried mauve petals

examine: Growing in clusters covering the ground, these short clover plants take root in the upper layer of soil and spread along the ground rather than growing both upward or further downward into the soil. Between six and eight inches in height, each stem has leaves that consist of three to six leaflets. When in season, these small yet hearty plants sport clusters of tiny flowers in white, yellow and a variety of red shades.
name: a handful of clover

examine: They are each about an inch long, and of roughly uniform width. At each end, the leaf rounds to a point. A heavy, sweet scent vaguely reminiscent of liquorice comes from the leaves.
name: a handful of narrow leaves

examine: The leaves are pale, but in places are darker. Their aroma is distinctive and unmistakable, that of marjoram.
name: a pinch of pale-green, crushed leaves

examine: These moist, crushed leaves give off a distinct aroma of thyme.
name: some scented crushed leaves

examine: These oval, grey-green leaves emanate a fragrance that soothes your lungs.
name: some grey-green leaves

examine: Made of simple leather, this pouch is supported by bluish-green metal bands coiling up from the base to its lip. Studded between these mildly hued bands, black faceted jewels reflect off the glowing metal and sparkle with an unmarred lustre.
name: a sable pouch

special_abilities: It is efficient against fire and cold.

examine: The thin necklace is wrought from finest silver chain, with a glowing, blue stone hanging from it.
name: a faintly glowing stone

examine: Inside the bowl is a liquid which reflects the light in all colours of the rainbow. The colours seem to shimmer and shift whenever the soup is viewed from different angles, and sometimes even when viewed from the same angle! In the soup are a few sliced, pale-brown mushrooms swimming around, glowing faintly and creating swirls of colours.
name: a bowl of colourful mushroom soup

examine: Maybe you can eat that?
name: a fortune-cookie

examine: The thin wafer doesn't look very filling, but it smells fresh and slightly sweet. It is wrapped in a silvery leaf of rare beauty.
name: a lembas wafer

examine: Made from the tail feather of a bird of flight, this pen is suitable for writing notes or messages.
name: a quill pen

examine: This is a long rod, with a hooked string at one end. Used to catch fish in water, it will allow the holder to 'fish'.
name: a fishing rod

examine: This is a 50 foot rope made of woven fibres. It looks like it can support a lot of weight and can be easily tied into knots.
name: a sturdy rope

examine: It is made of a plain metal, but looks durable. No designs or engravings mark it in any way; it is simply an eating utensil, nothing more.
name: a spoon

examine: A simple stick, with a curved handle. Useful for supporting anyone who may be unsteady on their feet.
name: a walking stick

examine: This is a very valuable set of equipment used by the practitioners of alchemy and herb lore. A variety of alembics, crucibles and glassware beakers make this quite versatile.
name: some alchemical supplies

examine: This tool is used for holding items too hot to handle properly.
name: a pair of tongs

examine: This pipe is carefully crafted to hold a good quantity of pipe-weed. It has a rather large bowl and the stem is over seven inches in length. The stem of the pipe is slanted and curved. Both the stem and the bowl seem to have been taken from the same piece of wood and fit perfectly together.
name: a wooden pipe

examine: These steamed crabs and the vegetables served with them look delicious.
name: some steamed crabs

examine: An entire roast duck is here waiting to be eaten. The plate is also filled up with many types of vegetables. It smells and looks delicious. I hope you are hungry since this is a big meal.
name: a plate of roast duck

examine: This plate of spicy grilled swordfish, rice and vegetables looks very tasty. The smell is very aromatic. It appears that the fish has been seasoned quite well, but what is that seasoning? Well, stop thinking about it and eat your meal.
name: some grilled swordfish

examine: This light and fluffy pastry has been baked to a golden brown. It looks perfect to top with any number of jams or jellies or even eaten plain.
name: a pastry

examine: The transparent cup is shaped like a half-closed lily resting on a large leaf. It is full of a liquid that has the scent of fresh grass and pine-needles. The fragrant liquid is golden-green like sunlight filtered through the crowns of the trees of the Golden Wood. It is not clear whether the cup itself or the liquid in it is the source of the soft green glow emanating from the potion.
name: a softly glowing green cup

special_abilities: It increases mana regeneration by ten and mana by ten for two hours.
After that, it increases mana regeneration by five and mana by five for four hours.
After that, it decreases mana regeneration by three and mana by five for six hours.

examine: The flask contains a thick, black liquid. It smells strongly of mildew and alcohol. On the back of the flask there is a clasp, making it possible to hang it from a belt.
name: a small metal flask

examine: Simple yet elegant in its shape, this flask is obviously of Noldorin make. Its contents cannot amount to more than a few mouthfuls: the draught beneath the silvery cork must be rare and precious, to be sipped on special occasions. The flask is almost full of miruvor.
name: a flask of miruvor

examine: This cube of ivory has black dots on each face. It is obviously meant to be held and thrown.
name: a die

examine: Cut in a cabochon, this deep blue gemstone displays a blue-white, six-rayed star in its middle. Unless kept in total darkness, the star seems to shine as bright as Helluin in a clear night.
name: a star sapphire

examine: Construction of this golden ring seems to have begun long ago. The band is smooth and polished, forming an unending circle. Miniature gold vines with intricately engraved leaves weave around to form a small inset, the perfect resting place for a finely cut gem.
name: an unfinished band of gold

examine: They have a pungent scent that clears your head. The leaves themselves are a very dark green, about the length of a man's thumb, and no wider than a fingernail.
name: some long, slender green leaves

examine: The stick is finely carved from an oak bough. Its upper end has a small knobby extension for a better grip, and its lower end is stumpy, fit to support its users steps. A pattern of small ornaments have been carved onto the surface of the walking stick, the lines entwining with each other at the middle of the oaken cane.
name: a stout oaken stick

examine: This light pipe is perfect for carrying in the pocket. Carved from a rich black wood embellished with leaves and trees made of fine silver and fitted with a pearl stem, this pipe is surely worthy of even the great Elf lords of Rivendell.
name: a fine elven pipe

examine: Over a hundred small rings have been linked together form a chained necklace with a small hook clasp on one side, and a pendant on the other end. On examining the chain further, it appears to be quite sturdy despite its rather diminuitive size. The pendant is shaped like a teardrop and has room for a gem to be mounted.
name: a glittering pendant

special_abilities: It is efficient against long range spells.

examine: These vambraces have been masterfully forged out of steel. The reinforced shoulders are connected to a durable metal cylinder to protect the upper arm. The elbow section is made out of concentric telescoping bands that are fitted together to allow free movement without leaving a gap. The smaller metal tubes for the forearms have strong hooks to securely attach gauntlets.
name: a white pair of metal vambraces

examine: These greaves are forged out of durable, polished steel plates. They cover the entire leg except for the knees, where strong, interwoven chains attach to the upper and lower leg parts. Black leather laces at the back of the greaves enable them to be adjusted to the size of the leg. An engraved set of buckles at the top allows attachment to other pieces of armour.
name: a white pair of metal greaves

examine: These are simple robes, made for everyday wear by those who favour this kind of apparel. The fabric of the robes is a rough and lacking in any patterns to distinguish, while the appearance of loose threads and small wear patterns to the cloth suggests that the robe has been washed many a time.
name: a crimson robe

examine: A large shield made from an unfamiliar black metal alloy. It is reinforced by a metal rim of deepest red colour. In the centre of the shield a hideous red eye stares out at you.
name: a black metal shield

examine: This key, masterfully fashioned from robust iron, boasts an antique finish and a handle designed in the likeness of a horse's head. The horse's mane elegantly transitions into the shaft, adorned with delicately etched fine lines and elaborate patterns. The body of the key, crafted from sturdy, darkened iron, exudes a time-honoured, vintage appearance.
name: an iron, horse-shaped key

examine: This very small key is made from solid granite; multi-coloured, hard and resistant to any weather. Since the key is so tiny it also is pretty simple, the blade does not have any cut notches or milled grooves in it.
name: a tiny stone key

examine: This is the fur of a great bear. For its enormous size and its extremely black colour, it must have belonged to one of the giant and ancient mountain bears, and specifically to the last one among them. There is no warg nor goblin in the Misty Mountains who has never shivered upon the mention of Beorn, the skin-changer.
name: a huge black bear fur

special_abilities: It is efficient against fire and cold.

examine: The robe is as black as pitch, and woven throughout with a dark thread that seems to absorb any light that falls upon it. The robe's ends are slightly ragged, and although it is light in weight, the robe carries a noticeable heaviness with it, a corrupted weariness.
name: a pitch-black robe

special_abilities: It returns mana after a short period of time when casting certain spells.
This effect does not stack for multiple uses of the same spell, but can be active for several spells at the same time.

examine: Impeccable craftmanship went into the creation of this shield. It is made of a peculiarly light but hard wood, secured within a moulded circle of silvery metal that has been meticulously engraved with delicate vines. The wood is a crosscut from a tree trunk with the telling growth rings visible. It looks fresh, as if it was recently cut from living tree. On the front, an emerald green, three-pronged leaf has been carved into the wood. A handle and straps on the back allow for a secure grip.
name: a leaf-embossed shield

examine: The ring, barely visible beneath the layers of ice that cover it, is made of a silvery metal and elegantly engraved. While the details of the engraving are not distinguishable beneath the ice, it is still evident that the ring was crafted with utmost care. The ice consists of several layers all uniformly covering the ring, with the top layer forming a smooth sharp edge. It shows no sign of melting - indeed its cold seems to radiate from within with a deep brilliance of whiteness. Yet it does not shine, casting no light that illuminates the surroundings. The light, and the cold, seem only to hit your eyes.
name: an icy ring

id_details.value: eighty-nine lauren, nine celeb, and fifty busc
special_abilities: It has three hundred charges left.

examine: This spear is made from one long thorn, almost seven feet in length. A small section of the shaft has been cut away and wrapped in leather, making it possible to wield this otherwise awkward weapon. The barbs that cover the thorn look capable of tearing flesh at the slightest brush.
name: a barbed thorny spear

examine: These gloves are crafted from tough, inflexible leather, designed to provide significant protection. The rigid material ensures durability, though at the cost of some dexterity.
name: a pair of rigid leather gloves

examine: Crafted with great skill this shield offers you good protection. Thick leather straps have been riveted on the inside to allow a sturdy grip to the handle of this huge shield.
name: a metal wall shield

examine: The hilt of this three foot long weapon is delicately wrapped with leather for a fine grip, while a sharply chiselled steel spike forms the tip of a broad crushing surface on the reverse side. While it is possible to wield the weapon with only one hand, the hilt is long enough to allow grasping it with both.
name: a steel-shafted mattock

examine: Covered in cobwebs, this key seems to be very old indeed. The metal of the key has a blue hue to it, possibly made from the same stone of the Blue Mountains.
name: an old metallic key

examine: Made of a dull metal, it looks as if it could only open the least complicated of locks.
name: a simple metal key

examine: The surface of the key is rough, with no sign of corrosion or any other type of damage. It is quite heavy, about five inches long with a large handle and small, sharp wards.
name: a rigid metal key

examine: You see a small grey stone sparkled with white spots. This stone seems to be very hard, maybe harder than iron. The whetstone is barely scratched and evidently has not been used much.
name: a stone

examine: So ravaged by the passage of time that it has become barely useable in combat, this ancient weapon, perhaps a relic of the First or Second Age, still retains some of its original elegance. The hilt is finely chiselled, and the blade - some thousand years ago - must have been extremely sharp.
name: an ancient dagger

examine: Skilfully woven from a silky, grey fibre, this rope is slender yet strong, and amazingly light.
name: a fine elven rope

examine: These tall coin-thick silvery pillars are usually found growing stiffly upright in swampy ground, the ancient guardians of springs and waterways. Their fine stalks are made of interwoven semi-translucent white threads that end with palm-wide stretches sticking out in all directions, each one of them crowned by a delicate sky-blue bloom. A trick of eye, a play of light reflecting off the threads, a strange distortion, makes for this plant's misty look, as if it was engulfed in its own cloak of fog, guarding it from those who want to look at it directly.
name: a misty plant

examine: This huge axe is several feet in length. The curved blade at the end gleams as if on its own accord, and strange runes lie embedded on the side. The shaft is made of smooth black metal, culminating in a handle made from tightly wound leather at the base.
name: a massive dwarven waraxe

examine: This wristband is made from a length of dry, thorn-covered vine. The vine is as thick as an arrow's shaft and as black as the sharp thorns that cover it. It is meant to be looped around a wrist several times and does not look either comfortable or particularly safe to wear. Long cracks cover the surface of the wristband, exposing unraveling bands of fiber.
name: a black-thorned wristband

examine: Only about seven inches by four, this thick little, leather-bound book appears to be some sort of a diary or journal. Almost all of its yellowed pages have been utterly destroyed. Of those that remain the majority are so badly damaged as to be completely illegible. But a few fragile leaves, some of them whole, and others with but a fragment or the paper clinging to the binding, still bear text in a small, neat script that remains readable despite the deterioration of the pages.
name: a small, worn book

examine: The key, skilfully crafted from a white-speckled stone, reflects the precision of elvish artistry. Its surface, smooth to the touch, bears intricate carvings that dance along its edges. The slender notches, painstakingly chiselled, align flawlessly. Despite its petite size, the key exudes an undeniable sense of elegance and grace.
name: an elegant white key

examine: This iron key has somehow been burnished, creating a surface that appears shinier than normal. It is average-sized, and has a loop on the handle that allows it to fit on a keyring.
name: a burnished iron key

examine: This heirloom is precious to the family that owns it, for it has been passed along from older members of the house to younger members for many generations. It resembles a green leaf with veins with silver. It seems to belong to a larger collection of items and as such does not seem to be valuable by itself.
name: an elven heirloom

examine: This is an extremely sharp and slender dagger with a hilt made of silver.
name: a slender dagger

examine: Here is a comfortable tunic of thick wool, that covers from shoulders to knees. It is dyed in an uniform brown colour, and it is wide enough as to not hinder its wearer's movements, yet it still has a very warm look.
name: a brown wool tunic

examine: The steel key is in good shape. The metal teeth are as crisp as when the key was first made.
name: a small steel key

examine: A simple key made of copper, it is very light and delicate. Patches of green can be seen where the key has begun to decay.
name: a small copper key

examine: The hilt of the sword is carved out of a single piece of shining black stone. Its blade is of a strange dark metal, which lacks lustre and seems to absorb all light that falls on it.
name: a dark broadsword

examine: Made of grey wood and less than two feet long, this arrow has a triangular head of metal and slots in the end for the bow's string. The wood is smooth and light, making it a good choice for archers.
name: a grey arrow

id_details.value: one lauren, eleven celeb, and twenty busc

examine: The sticky brownish mixture in the flask is lumpy, with semi-solid chunks of what seems to be rotten fruit and some tough fibres, possibly pieces of plant stems, which haven't been completely mashed to paste. The mush oozes an oily reddish liquid with a nauseating smell, which seems to be a mixture of the smell of swamp with the smell of decaying corpses and a sharp unpleasant flowery aroma that makes your eyes water.
name: a glass flask

examine: These gloves are made of supple black leather, almost silky to the touch. Though thin, light, and malleable, they still seem very durable. Trefoil leaves, stitched in green thread, cover the fingers and the palm. On the back, a large, stately tree has been embroidered in green, brown, and gold.
name: a supple pair of leather gloves

examine: This quiver has been carefully crafted from supple leather. It is moderately large, and could probably hold quite a number of arrows. A soft leather strap is attached and can be adjusted to allow you to wear this quiver over your shoulder or attached to a belt.
name: a quiver

examine: The ring is round and perfectly shaped to fit around a finger. Only a small marking can be found on the inside of the ring, a signature of the silversmith that forged it. The top of the ring features a square, silver setting with room for a gem. The ring has been embedded with a corberyl.
name: a relucent ring with a brilliantly clear gem

id_details.value: 111 lauren, seventeen celeb, and fifty busc
special_abilities: It is efficient against long range spells.

examine: Hundreds of seeds, shaped like miniature teardrops, are wrapped in hard shells marked with black-and-white lines. The exterior of the shell is slightly coarse, typically needing a small crack to reveal the treasure inside. Inside, a soft and creamy seed waits, offering a gentle hint of a nutty flavour.
name: a pile of sunflower seeds

examine: This majestic flower stands over six feet tall. It is crowned with bright yellow petals encircling a disc of brown seeds. The thick, coarse, and vertically ridged stem is blanketed in a prickly layer of hair. Along the stalk, rough leaves with heart-shaped, serrated edges sprout at alternating angles, giving it a tiered, elegant appearance.
name: a tall, radiant sunflower plant

examine: The hammer is heavy and solid to the touch, untouched by rust and time. The hammer-head is covered by engraved ornaments, tinted with a bluish metallic glow, and the shaft is made of bright, solid steel.
name: an ornate, steel-shafted warhammer

examine: A strong iron hook is attached to one end of a long coil of rope. Perhaps this might be used to help you climb, if thrown over something high above.
name: a long rope with a hook tied to the end

examine: Even a casual glance reveals this is no hen's egg, since it is rounder and a bit smaller. The surface feels relatively rough and the colour varies from a light to a darker tone of brown.
name: a small egg

examine: Crafted from supple, full-grain leather, this classic arm guard offers dependable protection and timeless style. Two sets of metal eyelets and a braided cord allow for a precise, comfortable fit, while the hand-stitched construction ensures years of dependable wear.
name: a bowman's arm guard

examine: This warhammer is very heavy. The metal it is made from is dark and strange; the handle is inlaid with silver and gold. It is so massive that only the strongest Naugrim could use it, delivering deadly force when it strikes a foe. The sides of the head are covered in silvery runes, surrounding a depiction of an anvil.
name: an engraved warhammer

examine: It is a moderately sized and robust but somewhat battered oil lantern made from brass, and it is equipped with a handle to make it handy and a hood to protect its flame. There is enough oil for more than half a week.
name: a lantern

examine: It is a large and robust but somewhat battered oil lantern made from brass, and it is equipped with a handle to make it handy and a hood to protect its flame. Some letters have been scratched on its bottom. There is enough oil for more than half a week.
name: a hooded brass lantern

examine: You see a fairly long piece of cured leather, with an iron buckle attached to one end.
name: a black leather belt

examine: You see a fairly long piece of cured leather, with an iron buckle attached to one end.
name: a plaid leather belt

examine: You see a fairly long piece of cured leather, with an iron buckle attached to one end.
name: an orange leather belt

examine: This narrow, single-edged blade has been inlaid with gold filigree from point to pommel. The grip is black leather, embossed with the image of a red hill against a setting sun. An intricately fashioned guard of silver cages the handle.
name: an ornamented sabre

examine: This weapon has a broad polished silver blade upon which many strange runes and symbols have been carved. The hilt is bound with fine leather through which threads of gold have been entwined. A solid silver pommel protects the wielder's hand in combat. The weapon is perfectly balanced and can be swung with an ease belying its deadliness.
name: an engraved broadsword

id_details.value: fifty lauren, three celeb, and sixty busc

examine: This key is roughly fashioned from metal, with an uneven surface and an unrefined shape. Its edges are jagged and its teeth are irregular, indicating it was made with minimal tools and skill. Despite its crude appearance, the key is sturdy and functional, suggesting it was designed for practical use rather than aesthetic appeal.
name: a crude metal key

examine: Lush, long white strands are held aloft by the generous padding of its downy undercoat of fuzzy white fur. The size of the skin seems large enough to carpet the major portion of an average sized room.
name: a soft, thick, white fur

examine: This bag is made of thin, soft leather. Inside, the bag holds several simple tools wrapped in woolen cloth, and an assortment of small containers, bottles, vials, and bowls. Seven pockets line the inside of the bag.
name: a herbal kit

examine: This slim hunting knife has been inlaid with several dazzling gemstones of various shapes and colours. The feel is light, yet sturdy in the hand.
name: a gem-inlaid knife

examine: Golden and green strands, woven into the likeness of a branch of golden leaves, make up this fine belt. The buckle is in the shape of an exquisitely detailed golden mallorn leaf.
name: a golden belt

id_details.value: 292 lauren, two celeb, and fifty busc

examine: A beautiful quiver of obvious elven craftsmanship, it is laced with a lining of gems and rubies that make your eyes sparkle.
name: a laced quiver

examine: You see a fairly long piece of cured leather, with an iron buckle attached to one end.
name: a grey leather belt

examine: The parchment is made of a maggot skin pulled over a support of birch rind and pine bark. Several pictures have been drawn in the first half of it and elven runes cover the remaining space. The drawings are easy to decipher: In the centre stands a tall man clad in white, who holds three lightning bolts in his right hand and throws a ball of fire from the other. Lying at his feet are several horses and blond-haired men, you figure to be dead Rohirrim. On either side are men wearing furs, the Dunlendings, impaling the corpses with long poles. Another picture shows the same white man at the foot of a huge tower, donating treasures and a crown to the Dunlendings. Below this is a short text written with decorated elven runes. At the bottom is a large elven S rune.
name: an ornate parchment

examine: These gauntlets have been masterfully forged out of steel. The metal of the wrists flare out to overlap the armour of the forearm. There are straps to attach the gauntlets securely. The back of each knuckle on every finger is protected by thick metal, and is hinged to allow free movement of the fingers.
name: a green pair of metal gauntlets

examine: An exceptionally smooth, polished band of gold wraps around in an unending circle to form this ring. Miniature gold vines with intricately engraved leaves weave around to form a small inset, in which rests a finely cut ruby.
name: a golden ruby ring

special_abilities: It can call a great eagle to carry you long distances.

examine: This plain ring is made of gold. The band has been tarnished lightly by time, but no scratches or other visible marks of use can be found on it. It has no other decorations than a small stone of quartzite attached to it. The ring feels quite heavy for its size.
name: a golden quartzite ring

special_abilities: It has fifty charges left for a level eighteen bless.

examine: This huge key is wrought in dark iron, and lacks all kinds of ornaments.
name: a Tharbad gate key

examine: There is a variety of tools, including slim, flat pieces and long, thin pieces, as well as strangely hooked and flattened pieces. Two of the lockpicks have shallow notches on them. Several of the picks have long, smooth grooves along their length.
name: a strange set of lock picks

examine: Forged long ago by the Men of Westernesse, this blade still gleams as new. A relic of the wars against the men of Carn Dm and their Witch-king, it has waited long years for the chance to shed the blood of the Dark Lord's servants once again.
name: a Dnadan blade

id_details.value: forty-one lauren, fifteen celeb, and ninety busc

examine: This keyring is fashioned from a shiny silver metal. It consists primarily of a large circle from which to hang keys and has a small but sturdy looking hook attached to the top.
name: a keyring

examine: Strung around a thin piece of vine, the daisies look to be slightly aged. It was made to fit around the wrist of a young human, but the vine can be stretched to fit by a skilled arteficer.
name: a small daisy chain

examine: This is a thin, fine-linked silver chain to which a small white stone has been attached so that it can be worn around the neck. The stone is a thin round of sparkling white marble, in which has been etched a drawing of a ship sailing on a calm sea under fluffy clouds.
name: a necklace

examine: The thin necklace is wrought from finest silver chain, with a dull, black stone hanging from it.
name: a dark stone

examine: These boots are dark black and smooth on the surface. One of them has a small sheath sewn on the outer side, serving as a holder for a dagger or another equally small weapon.
name: a pair of smooth, black boots

examine: Although very light, the leggings are made with a surprisingly strong metal. They don't restrict movement in any way while worn.
name: a shining pair of chain mail leggings

examine: Countless very small rings of hard steel have been used to create this armour. Around the wrists the gloves consist of two layers of mail, while the fingers are formed by many complicated patterns, which nearly offer as much feeling and control as a piece of chainmail can.
name: a fine pair of chain mail gloves

examine: The metal of the sleeves is very light, but very strong. The links are very fine, and the sleeves seem as comfortable as normal cloth.
name: a shining pair of chain mail sleeves

examine: The cloak is made from a finely-woven fabric of a deep reddish-brown colour. Thin strands of darker browns, and minute flecks of silver-grey lend to the fabric a richer look, which complements the superior workmanship and subtle styling of the garment.
name: a russet cloak

examine: It is exceptionally light, and can fit even under normal clothes. However, the mesh of the shirt does not seem as though it would break easily.
name: a shining chain mail shirt

examine: This circlet is simple, yet elegant. A small but flawless ruby is set into a plain band of shimmering mithril, crafted to fit comfortably around one's head.
name: a mithril circlet

examine: The silvery blade is heavier and thicker than most daggers and is obviously ancient. Miniature carvings on its surface depict battles against a dark army, resulting in the fall of Eregion.
name: a ceremonial dagger

examine: Shorter and lighter than the normal two-handed sword, the claymore is still close to five feet long and heavy enough to cause severe damage when striking a target. The grip, carefully bound with finest leather, is large enough to allow the wielder to grasp the great sword in either one or two hands, depending on the style with which the owner prefers to fight. The sword is set with a wheel pommel, capped by a crescent shaped nut and a guard with straight, down sloping arms ending in quatrefoils and enruned langets running down the centre of the blade from the guard. A faint glow emanates from the metal, and sometimes a slight tremble runs down the length of the exceptionally sharp blade.
name: a steel claymore

examine: This sword is long and thin, having a slight curve to it. The blade is restricted to one side, the back of the sword being somewhat thickened. The hilt offers moderate protection to the hand that wields it.
name: a backsword

examine: These sleeves are constructed from high-quality rigid leather, reinforced for added durability. The inner lining is designed to offer some comfort, while the outer layer provides excellent protection against physical harm.
name: a sturdy pair of rigid leather sleeves

examine: These hardened leather boots are completely covered with large and heavy plates of pure steel. Long iron vises attach the plates to the leather, preventing them from slipping off. Several metal clips enable enclosure of the boots.
name: a sturdy pair of metal boots

examine: The green vial drips with a disgusting mixture which smells like rotten flesh.
name: a foetid green vial

special_abilities: It contains oil, poisoned with level twenty venom that would last for three hours.

examine: Carvings forming detailed patterns cover the thin glass bottle, and a foul smell seeps past the dark-brown cork stoppering it. A green fluid has tainted the glass.
name: a green stinking vial

special_abilities: It contains oil, poisoned with level twenty poison that would last for three hours.

examine: The vial is filled with a dark red liquid in which are floating dead spiders.
name: a dirty reddish vial

special_abilities: It contains oil, poisoned with level twenty-two arachnia that would last for one hour.

examine: This bowl holds a dark, aromatic brew, its surface occasionally disturbed by floating bits of herbs. The scent is a complex blend of juniper berries, clover, marjoram, and cloves, offering a fresh and earthy fragrance.
name: a bowl of brew

special_abilities: It increases movement point regeneration by ten and decreases willpower by three for twenty-four hours.
After that, it increases movement point regeneration by five and decreases willpower by one for one hundred twenty hours.
After that, it increases movement point regeneration by three and decreases willpower by one for twenty-four hours.

examine: The wooden mug contains a brown liquid with a strong tint of green. There are small clovers floating around in the brew, and tiny parts of root beneath the surface can be made out. The aroma is very strong.
name: a mug of brew

special_abilities: It increases movement points by ten and movement point regeneration by ten for one hundred twenty hours.
After that, it increases movement points by seven and movement point regeneration by seven for twenty-four hours.
After that, it increases movement points by three and movement point regeneration by three for twenty-four hours.

examine: Made from thick metal these boots offer great protection, yet are quite heavy. With the various metallic parts neatly linked together by chains, this pair makes out an extremely sturdy foot-wear for a warrior.
name: a fine pair of metal boots

examine: This bottle is made of dark, stained glass which upon closer inspection yields an almost smokey complexion. A simple cork stopper plugs the mouth of the bottle. The shape is quite unnatural; no sides are the same, and it is even only on its bottom.
name: a sombre bottle

special_abilities: It decreases willpower by one and perception by three for ten hours.
After that, it increases defensive bonus by two and decreases perception by two for sixty hours.
After that, it increases defensive bonus by one and decreases perception by one for thirty hours.

examine: The cake is made of a sweet and sticky paste, containing various parts of plants, and wrapped in lance-shaped hairy green leaves. Flower fragments of a purple-like colour, with occasional fluffy red brushes, are barely visible in the mixture. It emits a sweetish and faintly aromatic smell, inviting you to take a mouthful of it.
name: a leaf-cake

examine: A heavy fur with long black outer hairs and a softer, black undercoat. This wolf fur looks as if it could keep someone warm in the cold.
name: a black wolf fur

examine: Looking very old and ragged, this dress was once a nice piece of clothing. Now it is just a tattered piece of decaying cloth.
name: an old plain dress

examine: These gauntlets have been masterfully forged out of steel. The metal of the wrists flare out to overlap the armour of the forearm. There are straps to attach the gauntlets securely. The back of each knuckle on every finger is protected by thick metal, and is hinged to allow free movement of the fingers.
name: a black pair of metal gauntlets

examine: Made from thick metal these boots offer great protection, yet are quite heavy. With the various metallic parts neatly linked together by chains, this pair makes out an extremely sturdy foot-wear for a warrior.
name: a green pair of metal boots

examine: These vambraces have been masterfully forged out of steel. The reinforced shoulders are connected to a durable metal cylinder to protect the upper arm. The elbow section is made out of concentric telescoping bands that are fitted together to allow free movement without leaving a gap. The smaller metal tubes for the forearms have strong hooks to securely attach gauntlets.
name: a green pair of metal vambraces

examine: These greaves are forged out of durable, polished steel plates. They cover the entire leg except for the knees, where strong, interwoven chains attach to the upper and lower leg parts. Black leather laces at the back of the greaves enable them to be adjusted to the size of the leg. An engraved set of buckles at the top allows attachment to other pieces of armour.
name: a green pair of metal greaves

examine: This heavy, thick metal breastplate was obviously crafted by a master armourer. It will protect its owner from all but the mightiest blows.
name: a green metal breastplate

examine: The steel blade of this dagger is of triangular section and about eight inches long. Both of its slightly curved edges have been sharpened, ending in a dangerous-looking point. The metal part continues through the nearly inexistent quillons and the wooden hilt, finally enlarging into a smooth piece that balances the weight of the weapon.
name: an elven dagger

examine: This dagger is slender and appears delicate, but despite its looks it has remarkable balance. Both sides of the thin, double-edged blade are engraved with intricate, softly shimmering patterns that seem to rest impossibly deep within the metal.
name: a nimble blade

examine: Many small rings have been interwoven to form a decent armour for the head. Long chains hang over the neck and the cheeks, improving protection but also hindering sight as well as the head's freedom of movement.
name: a chain mail coif

examine: This small metal key is covered in filth and has started to rust. It is slightly bent and dented from careless use, but might still work on a lock somewhere. The design is very crude and likely of orkish origin.
name: a filthy, bent key

examine: Delicate links of gold form a light chain of about sixteen inches in length. At the midpoint of the chain is set a small, glimmering white, lightning-shaped metallic object.
name: a lightning-shaped pendant

special_abilities: It has one hundred charges left.
It decreases the mana cost of control weather.
Casting control weather may make you conductive and vulnerable to lightning.

examine: This ancient weapon emanates an aura of powerful goodness. The great steel head, sharpened and polished, still bears the burn-marks of the balrog's flame.
name: a blackened dwarven axe

examine: Although it has the length of a regular longsword, from its weight and thin blade it is evident that this sword is lighter. Moreover, its hilt is not pure metal, but rather has two large, dark, wooden pieces assembled upon a thin steel sheet. Even so, it looks finely tempered and thoroughly balanced. Metals are scarce in the Anduin Vales, and thus weapon smiths there prefer to forge lighter, handier weapons.
name: a Beorning sword

examine: The withered ring is made of a single root that is surprisingly sturdy and was somehow coaxed to grow into a near perfect circle that solidly reconnects back into itself. Its brown surface is becoming increasingly weathered with cracks and some of the terminated lateral shoots along its meandering path have broken off. The root is still alive even though it is starting to show signs of decay.
name: a root ring

id_details.value: eighty-nine lauren, nine celeb, and fifty busc
special_abilities: It has one hundred eighty charges left.
It is infused with Entish magic and will keep the wearer rooted when the earth is in upheaval.
It can be used to nourish a tree and encourage it to grow.

examine: Almost six feet tall, and rather heavy for a spear, this odd weapon is made entirely out of metal. The shaft is created out of a black, dull metal which hardly reflects any light. A bright contrast is the serrated head, sparkling and glittering silver, whose point is lethally sharp.
name: a blackened spear

examine:
The book seems to be quite old, but its battered leather binding is still sturdy. Embossed on the grey leather is a round emblem which looks like a heraldic device: a cornflower pattern with twelve slender petals in shades of blue and white. You can look at the table of contents and the copyright notice, or hold the book and then read book page
.
name: a grey leather-bound book

examine: The skull is smelling to high heavens, and some remains of flesh and other slimy substances are still visible deep within it.
name: a strange white skull

special_abilities: It is a cursed and unsellable object.

examine: You see a fairly long piece of cured leather, with an iron buckle attached to one end.
name: a brown leather belt

examine: This axe has an iron head crafted for raw brutality. The attention of whoever wrought it was clearly focused on the cruelly-honed edge of the blade rather than on the aesthetic form of the head. The axe-head is bound by thick leather straps to a dark shaft of twisted wood roughly one and a half feet long. Mottled black and red stains discolour the otherwise white colour of the leather.
name: a wicked Durbk-hai axe

examine: This spear has a smooth wooden shaft, about five feet long, with a small metal tip at its top. Quality craftsmanship is obvious in the weapon's balance - it is perfectly weighted and very easy to handle. A leather wrap two feet from the bottom acts as a handgrip, with the emblem of a horse prominent in the wood just above.
name: a steel-tipped spear

examine: About a yard and a half long, it is made from a hardened wood, reinforced with metal. Its head is smooth and round, well balanced so that you can move it quickly and accurately.
name: a maul

examine: A crude weapon, this large wooden club has several thick and pointy iron nails driven through its head.
name: a huge spiked club

examine: This huge sword stands as tall as most men. Its blade is broad, made of a bluish metal that seems exceptionally sharp and heavy. The hilt is large and can only be grasped with two hands, and then even barely. The whole sword vibrates to some unknown call, perhaps the call of battle that it so yearns for. A slightly glowing red line traces runes up the flat side of the blade.
name: a great warsword

id_details.value: fifty-four lauren, five celeb, and fifty busc

examine: It appears crude, but brutally effective. Its large blade has a jagged edge, giving a toothed appearance.
name: a jagged-edged scimitar

examine: This small spade has a short wooden handle attached to an iron head. It could be used for gardening or similar tasks.
name: a small spade

examine: The thorn is very much like the thorn of a rose, with only a slight difference in size: it is big as a short sword and, in fact, feels quite comfortable in one's hand. Its point is immensely sharp, and a green liquid slowly drips from it. Since it is not made of iron, it is also rustproof.
name: a sharp thorn

examine: This weapon is deceptively light and swift and its curved blade seems designed best to eviscerate enemies quickly. Faint traces of dried blood are imbedded between the serrations on the blade. Its hilt seems strangely sticky.
name: a long, wicked knife

examine: It is a three foot long, thin, single edged, sharp blade, with the shape of a huge fang. A small white skull is engraved on its handle. It is a crude weapon with no aesthetics, as all orkish weapons are, but it looks quite effective.
name: a nasty orkish fang

examine: This huge spear has a long broad spearhead, its edge stained with blood from several battles. The shaft is dark and made out of hard wood, making it even heavier to fight with. This is a weapon made for strong warriors.
name: a giant spear

examine: A blade of Nmenrean origin, approximately one and one half feet in length. It appears to be a short, stabbing weapon with a broad blade, pointed and double-edged.
name: a double edged eket

id_details.value: two lauren, twelve celeb, and ninety busc

examine: The ring looks old and elven. It is made of fine Dwarven steel, with several rubies set in a splendid pattern. Crafted during the Second Age, this grey-steel ruby ring reflects a rare period of cooperation between Elves and Dwarves, combining their unmatched skills in metallurgy and gem-setting.
name: an ancient ruby ring

examine: You see a beautifully knit piece of wolfskin. The wristband must have been made by a craftsman of Old.
name: a grey wolfskin wristband

examine: You see a beautifully knit piece of wolfskin. The wristband must have been made by a craftsman of Old.
name: a white wolfskin wristband

examine: You see a beautifully knit piece of wolfskin. The wristband must have been made by a craftsman of Old.
name: a black wolfskin wristband

examine: This long lance has been carved from a single straight branch. One end was sharpened and covered with hardened steel.
name: a steel-tipped lance

examine: About six feet long, it is made of a dark red bone, very light for its size. The haft is wrapped in long strips of hide that twist around the wood for a better grip. About halfway along the length of the spear, it twists and spirals several times, separating then into two sharp points.
name: a twisted spear

examine: This large pole arm is comprised of a burnished metal blade, decorated with a fine pattern of silver threads embedded into the metal. The blade is affixed to a long, polished pole of ash. Its butt end is fitted with a cruel steel spike. Runic adornments wind around the shaft of the spear. It is too hefty to be wielded with a single hand.
name: a burnished hewing-spear

properties: silver metal stabbing weapon of slashing nature

examine: This staff appears at first to be made out of a solid dark wood, but at a closer inspection the weight and reflections in the material tell a sure tale. The entire staff, five feet long, is made out of a black metal, almost one inch thick. It is cold to the touch, heavy and unyielding.
name: a black metal staff

id_details.value: nine lauren, seventeen celeb, and forty busc

examine: It is a mid-sized axe, made of a black metal alloy. Orkish runes, carved into the shaft, speak of the gory death that awaits the wielder's foes.
name: a black waraxe

examine: About six feet long, this wooden staff was crafted from a knotted branch, without paying much attention to the details. Nevertheless it looks like it can parry severe blows, or crush someone's head, without suffering much damage itself.
name: a rough staff

examine: A whip of braided leather extends over six feet in length from a sturdy wooden hilt. The tip has been frayed into short fingers.
name: a whip

examine: The lance is made of a long straight length of timber, with one end flared to guard a grip that has been carved into it. The other end tapers to a keen point.
name: a lance

examine: You see an elven hunting-spear with a long and sharp blade.
name: an elven hunting-spear

examine: This spear is five feet in length, and the shaft is composed entirely of steel. The head is long and broad and composed of a dark metal. The metal of the head was fused to the shaft with a great amount of heat and force. The spear was never refinished or polished, making the weapon crude looking, but very effective.
name: a steel-shafted spear

examine: This short, rough iron spear was crafted without paying much attention to the details, probably during a period of unrest when it was important to forge many weapons quickly. Its ugliness does not make the spear less lethal.
name: a short spear

examine: This is an ordinary spear which is about six feet in length. The head of the spear is long and narrow. The butt of the spear is shod in iron to make the spear durable.
name: a longspear

examine: This spear has a very broad head made of a dark heavy metal. To complement the head there are two small prongs on either side of the head. The shaft of this weapon is over six feet in length.
name: a broad spear

examine: The fork consists of a long, wooden handle and a metal cross-bar with four spikes attached to its lower end. Although designed as a farmer's tool, it can nevertheless be quite deadly if used as weapon.
name: a pitchfork

examine: This extra long spear is shod in iron at its base, which is used to support the tip when engaged against a mounted opponent. The tip of the spear is rudimentary, but very effective when handled by a skilled warrior.
name: a pike

examine: This hammer has a tough wooden handle and a solid metal head.
name: a warhammer

examine: The long and heavy shaft of this hammer is topped by a massive head, which is secured and reinforced to the shaft by two strong pieces of metal.
name: a heavy warhammer

examine: This is a wooden hammer with a metal head. One side of the head is rounded, the other flat. The wooden handle is roughly a foot long and has a hole at the end. A sturdy leather thong loops through the hole, tied into a circle.
name: a hammer

examine: Quite a bit larger than your average weapon of this type, this warhammer has a great iron-bound handle and a massive iron head.
name: a large warhammer

examine: The staff is about six feet in length and is made from some pale, hard wood.
name: a quarterstaff

examine: This often useful tool has a wooden handle and a broad metal scoop for digging.
name: a shovel

examine: The pick is a standard type, the one usually used by dwarves.
name: a pick

examine: This weapon is comprised of a spiked metal ball, attached to a stout wooden handle by a short length of iron chain.
name: a morningstar

examine: This morningstar has a heavy metal ball with large spikes. A length of heavy iron chain joins it to a tough wooden handle which is reinforced with iron straps.
name: a heavy morningstar

id_details.value: two lauren, five celeb, and fifty busc

examine: You judge the steel shaft of this huge weapon to be at least five feet long. A massive head of polished annealed steel is fitted to the head of the shank and a foot long hilt of carved mahogany is fitted to the other. Dwarven runes adorn the weapon, carved into the wood of the handle, the gleaming steel of the shaft, and tempered steel of the weighty head.
name: a war mattock

id_details.value: forty-nine lauren, nineteen celeb, and seventy busc

examine: This mace bears several iron studs driven into a stout wooden handle.
name: a mace

examine: It is large and heavy, and its head bears a dozen sharp, iron spikes. It appears as though it was made for the purpose of shredding metal and bone alike.
name: a cruelly-spiked mace

examine: This flail is just a short stick connected to a wooden handle, from which it can swing freely. Normally used for threshing, in case of emergency it could also become a weapon.
name: a flail

examine: This short, heavy club is about two and a half feet long. It is little more than part of a thick tree limb which has been crudely finished; the bark has been removed, and one end has been shaped into a hand grip.
name: a cudgel

examine: A simple weapon, merely a carved piece of lumber. It is crude, but still capable of making a point.
name: a wooden club

examine: A long, heavy club with a wicked, barbed spike at the end surrounded by many smaller spikes. It looks of orkish make.
name: a spiked war club

examine: This rough club has been hewn from an old knotted piece of timber.
name: a gnarled wooden club

examine: This branch has been ripped from a large tree. It is very large and heavy and it looks like it would make a suitable club for some gigantic creature.
name: a very heavy branch

examine: Made of heavy, thick pine and weighted with a centre rod of iron, this club is a dangerous weapon. The base, wrapped tightly in leather strips, allows for two hands to wield this blunt, deadly club.
name: a very large wooden club

examine: This very large branch has been ripped from a tree. It is almost eight feet long, making it difficult to swing one-handed. Its base is splintered where it was broken off and is much thicker than the tip. Almost straight, this branch is slightly curved and covered with numerous knots.
name: a very large knotted tree-branch

examine: This weapon was made by attaching an axeblade to an eight-foot pole. The blade is longer and heavier than that of a halberd, and the pole is longer.
name: a poleaxe

properties: metal cleaving weapon of stabbing nature

examine: This light axe is primarily meant as a light wood-axe, being used to clear branches and debris. The blade is backed up by a hammer on the opposite side.
name: a hatchet

examine: The axe has a sharp broad blade on one side and a sharpened hook on the other which balances the weapon. The top of the weapon has a small, sharpened spike at the tip. The handle is shorter than most war axes and it is clear this weapon is meant for close personal combat.
name: a handaxe

examine: The blade of this weapon is a small curved axe on one side, and a small hammer attached to its opposite. The tip of this weapon is a sharpened spike which makes it effective versus a mounted opponent. The pole the blade is attached to is well over seven feet in length.
name: a halberd

properties: metal cleaving weapon of stabbing nature

examine: This heavy, broad-bladed hatchet would serve well for slaughtering animals.
name: a butcher's cleaver

examine: The blade is large and roughly square, although it curves slightly. The haft is not very long, but it is sturdy. The weapon looks to be designed to shed the most blood possible, and cause the most pain, in each hit.
name: a brutal cleaver

examine: This axe has a large, stout and heavy iron blade suitable for chopping wood. The long handle is made of hickory wood and wrapped in leather.
name: a woodsman's axe

examine: The head of this axe is forged from fine steel. The blade has a deadly curve to it and is polished to a shine. The back of the head forms a sharp spike. The long, wooden haft has been polished to a rich, glossy black. Strips of leather and silvery wire form intricate patterns where the haft is wrapped to provide a sure and firm grip.
name: a two-handed axe

examine: This axe is very old, but the blade, forged from dwarven steel, is still polished, exposing fine carved dwarven scrollwork and possessing a sharpness like none you've ever seen before. There are some runes etched on the blade.
name: a mighty dwarven axe

id_details.value: thirteen lauren, nineteen celeb, and fifty busc

examine: The favourite weapon of many a dwarf warrior, the double-headed axe is a nimble weapon considering its weight. This one is unadorned and simply crafted - a three foot plain wooden shaft with a curved steel blade running half its length on each side.
name: a double-headed axe

examine: This axe bears a single-edge and is balanced by a pointed spike on the opposite side of its handle. The grip is bound with leather to give the wielder ample defensive ability at close quarters.
name: a battle axe

examine: This light dagger has a blade that shines with a soft yellow light, its handle is made of beautiful golden coloured metal.
name: a shiny dagger

examine: With its blood-stained claws, this talon can cause nasty wounds.
name: a sharp talon

examine: The great sword has a long, heavy blade nearly measuring five feet in length. Its grip seems straight and allows the use of both hands when swinging it. The quillions slant slightly towards the tip of the blade, providing little or no protection for you.
name: a two-handed sword

examine: This crude weapon is more suited for harvesting the wheat, than killing. It is cumbersome, with a six foot long pole and a long curved blade attached at the end. A handle at the opposite end can be grasped for better support during harvest, to effectively swipe through the grass. This extra handle would be of no use to an attacker however, and the weapon is meant to be used one-handed.
name: a sickle

examine: The edge of the curved blade of this weapon consists of dozens of tiny sharp teeth, so that the scimitar will tend to rip flesh, as well as slashing it.
name: a serrated scimitar

examine: This is a thin and razor-sharp sword. It curves backward and bears a sharp point. The handle and the fashioning of the blade are indicative Orcish craftsmanship.
name: a scimitar

examine: This is a huge scimitar, curving and broad. Its weight and size indicates any blow from this weapon would be brutal. It seems of orkish make.
name: a broad scimitar

examine: A long straight sword, but with only one sharp edge.
name: a sabre

examine: The sword has a long straight blade, a strong hilt and a sturdy grip.
name: a longsword

examine: This is a broad knife with a rough wooden handle. Apparently, it has other uses than just cutting meat.
name: a broad-bladed knife

examine: This single-edged blade is short and very broad, with a small crosspiece for protection. The tip of the blade is curved, so that a large portion of the blade's edge is exposed.
name: a falchion

examine: This sword has a slightly curved blade with a single sharp edge. A single metal bar arcs over the grip to provide a simple guard.
name: a cutlass

examine: This massive flat-bladed weapon has a long protective cross guard. The handle is wrapped with leather; a one-inch ball is set at the end to counterbalance the blade.
name: a broadsword

examine: This is a thorn, but much larger than anything to be found on an ordinary plant. It is the size of a dagger, in fact, and as sharp. Brown, oily, and slick-surfaced, it must have been shed by a large stem indeed.
name: a brown thorn

examine: A long and thin knife, or perhaps a short and thin shortsword, the stiletto is long and slim with a dangerously sharp point.
name: a stiletto

examine: This is a short broad-bladed weapon of average quality with a crescent-shaped pommel, which was made of brass. It is good for a quick fighting-style and fast thrusts.
name: a shortsword

examine: This sword is short and is very thin, with little to its cutting edge. A crossguard covers the wielder's hand. The weapon is light and meant for thrusting.
name: a rapier

examine: The blade is about 5 inches long, curved at the tip. Along the back of the blade is a serrated portion, perhaps to cut bone.
name: a hunting knife

examine: This light knife has a long flat blade made for cutting. The perfect tool for splitting, stripping and cutting meat.
name: a butcher knife

examine: It is a long, backwards curving horn with thick, transversal ridges. Although hollow, you feel that it's pretty resistant. Its point is also quite sharp. A horse leaves west.
name: a horn

examine: The dirk has quite a thick blade, which is wide in relation to its length. The blade is set in a black wooden handle with a rough criss-cross pattern carved into it.
name: a dirk

examine: This blade is two sided, ten inches long and one inch wide. The hilt offers little protection and the handle is large enough for the hand of a man. It is otherwise a well balanced weapon, useful in close quartered combat.
name: a dagger

examine: This mace is made of a strong timber handle over which a spiked iron cap with inch-long spikes has been fitted.
name: an iron-shod mace

examine: This round cake is about a hand's span in diameter, and a couple inches high. Its crust has a light burnt shade, but the inside is golden brown, like the honey it has been made of. The Beorning bakers cook these honeycakes twice, to make them more durable. Thus, they turn out to be especially useful for weary travellers.
name: a honey-scented cake

examine: This flower seems to suck in all of the light that passes near it. The deep gloom that surrounds it blurs its soft, black petals. Its red centre is a stark contrast to the dark petals, though its hue would appear quite muted if compared with that of any other flower. This foul bloom exudes an acrid scent of corruption.
name: a black, corrupted flower

examine: The pallet is made of loose feathers and straw and is suitable for a nights' rest. No care is taken in its upkeep however, and over the years it has accumulated a thick layer of dust and grime.
name: a filthy straw pallet

examine: The berries have a rusty orange to bright red colour. Each berry is about one half of an inch in diameter, oval shaped with one small seed in the centre.
name: a few hawthorn berries

examine: Cracked bones, pulverized flesh and sinew as well as blood are mixed in this clay pot. The mixture is cold and smells very badly.
name: a pot of mashed elf

examine: Patches of discoloured leather have been roughly stitched together into a cylindrical form and fortified with several leather straps, forming an aqeduate quiver. Many of the stitches appear to have been done in haste, as they are of different lengths and are not very straight either. One of the straps is longer than the others and even features a small buckle, allowing the current owner to fit the quiver on a belt or over the shoulders.
name: a rough, large quiver

examine: The robe is made of coarse cloth, the colour so dark that it seems to absorb light itself. It has no feature or adornment, but seems to exude an aura of hidden power.
name: a coarse dusky robe

examine: The phial glows with a warm white light, capable of piercing even the thickest darkness. It is warm and smooth to the touch, and at the same time so hard that it could withstand almost anything, save perhaps the fires of the earth, without even being marred. The silver light of the phial is bright. You realise that this phial is owned by Lumpin.
name: a small crystal phial

special_abilities: It will cause evil creatures to hesitate before attacking you.
It can be used to shine the light of Elbereth and drain mana from evil.

examine: Small green stones are arranged in the pattern of a flower's petals on this small circular brooch. Obviously elf-work, its style is unusual: it looks similar to the craft of the Elves of Gondolin, yet it is not that.
name: a green brooch

examine: This six feet ancient oak wand has some mithril runic inscriptions on it. On its top a pale glowing blue crystal is fixed by three fine gold claws. Looking closer, you are able to see some more details: namely, an oblong, reddish-orange gemstone has been set in the staff's base, a barely visible piece of honey-coloured amber has been embedded deep into the staff, a small beryl has been embedded into the staff, a small gem, twinkling in shades of gold, red and brown is embedded near the staff's tip, a small oval-shaped gem glittering in shades of pink is inlaid in it, a six-rayed star shines from the middle of a blue stone set in the staff, an orb of black metal surrounds its tip, silvery bands encircle it from top to bottom, and its foot is shod with iron. You realise that this wand is owned by Barinak.
name: an Istari wand

examine: This is a small glass bottle, there is dark red liquid inside. The bottle is closed tightly with small wooden cap. Looking closely, there is a thin layer of insoluble particles on the bottom of the glass, but a quick shake of the bottle makes them disappear.
name: a small, maroon bottle

examine: This is a rich ebony shirt whose hem falls well below the belt. The fine cloth has a shimmering quality to it that plays tricks on the eyes. There are delicate and fine patterns embroidered along the borders and cuffs of the tunic in a silvery thread.
name: an ebony tunic

id_details.value: twenty-one lauren, seven celeb, and fifty busc
special_abilities: It confuses attackers and grants a chance of combat elusion.

examine: The runes on this well-polished shortsword are very ancient and definitely elven-made, but so arcane and old that you cannot decipher anything.
name: the polished Elven shortsword

special_abilities: It is efficient against Trolls and Orcs.

examine: A translucent, deep blue sapphire, cut in cabochon shape, has been mounted on this elaborately chiselled and enruned ring; a white six-rayed star shines in the centre of the jewel. The ring is made out of solid iron and emits a dim twinkling light. You realise that this ring is owned by Hoplite.
name: an iron sapphire ring
